The lack of Leadership and hospitality revealed itself, from the moment we stepped into the Front Desk area. The staff choice ( Diego and Junior) seemed like two teenagers behind the desk. No greeting skills, poor check-in process, and no amenities explanation. Never seen such a poor customer service since I’ve been staying in hotels and motels.  Both agents had such a bad attitude from the start. The morning gal ( Jen) had a better demeanor but kinda flat. The staff looked depressed and unhappy to be there.  The GM Moe Kasfy must know that he is running a mediocre operations at FFMV. I hope

Summary: This works if you just need a place to sleep with few amenities.  It's not the nicest Fairfield and our room was very small.  With us and our luggage it was tough to walk around the room.  The closet was very small.  The breakfast is the average fare.  The staff was OK.  I have no real complaints and it is convenient to the highway (right beside it so we had a bit of traffic noise) and to Mission Viejo. There is no housekeeping in the rooms until you're there four days. I highly recommend Oso Creek Trail if you're staying here and want to take a walk or jog.  It's a very short drive and is a beautiful trail.  We really enjoyed Panini Kabob Grill in MV - delicious, very fresh and reasonably priced Mediterranean food.

When I brought it to the front desks attention days in advance of the checkin date, they stated it was prepaid and there was nothing they could do about it.  Took 4 days to get a manager of the facility to return my call at which time he stated he would not correct the error and that the best he could do was offer their "Best available rate" on a future room booking.  This place is a joke and managed as such.  Book somewhere else.

Summary: More than any other recent stay at a hotel, my experience at the Fairfield Inn by Marriott Mission Viejo Orange County in October 2022 highlighted the post-COVID 19 imbalance between the price paid for a room and the level of service received.   Three times during a stay of three nights, I kindly asked the hotel to provide housekeeping service to my room. If full service could not be provided, I explained, then please at least refresh my bathroom and towels. Upon each request, the hotel's front desk personnel typed something into the computer. Each morning during my stay, I observed housekeepers working on my floor of the hotel. Yet, none of my requests were respected. Never once over the course of three days and three nights did I receive any housekeeping service whatsoever.
Room tip: Upon checking in, negotiate the frequency with which the hotel claims it will service your room.

Summary: Do not stay here unless you want bedbugs and terrible customer service. I have stayed over 500 nights with Marriott and the condition of the hotel along with the attitude of the staff are hands down the worst that I've ever experienced. While I realize that anyone can bring in bedbugs, this hotel was filthy, so I shouldn't have been surprised, and given the staff's lack of a reaction, I can only assume that this was not unusual for them. I captured a bedbug in the plastic garbage bag to show the staff and they were condescending and downright rude. The travel agency my company uses has blocked this hotel as an option and I would encourage anyone reading this review to do the same. There are plenty of clean hotels in the area that are similarly priced.

Summary Heading: Old and not in a good way
Summary: I can’t believe no one would mention in the reviews how old this hotel is. There is nothing that can be done with this facility except to tear it down and rebuild it.   The ceilings are so low, it’s uncomfortable to even stand in the building. Rooms, furniture, curtains, A/Cs everything is old, it’s disgusting.  ACs kicks starts and then stops. Rooms are tiny! We were 2 adults and 2 kids, Yet they put us in 1 room. Apparently this hotel only has double and king bedrooms with no option to upgrade to suite. The lighting is bad too. Old fashioned lamps. This hotel is antique and not in a good way. Wet and old-person vibe going on.   When we checked in at 8:30pm, some guests were eating ethnic food by the entrance and it stank up the entire lobby. There were also dirt stains outside
Room tip: Manage your expectations. This does not feel like a Marriott hotel.

The worker kept talking, and I couldn't understand him.  The guy at the other desk shouted the information to me.  Another customer came in and talked with the employee on the right. Summary: So, first and foremost-this property is dated. But don't let that scare you away. It is VERY clean and in a great location. I hope it has plans for a renovation soon to match the style of some of the newer Fairfield Inns!   Parking was easy, location optimal, close to restaurants, gas, shopping areas, etc. We were there for an event not far away and I have to say I was pleasantly surprised.  Breakfast could use a little work. It isn't as good as the other Fairfield Inns I've stayed at-but it fits the bill for a free breakfast. Hot foods, waffles, cereal, etc. Coffee & tea out all day.   We had a highway facing room and I didn't hear any noise at all.

I am writing this review because when I booked this hotel there was hardly any recent reviews. The hotel is great for families. The breakfast is perfect, waffles, cereal,eggs,cheese omelets, turkey sausage, hash browns, yogurt, etc.  People mentioned the noise but it was quite in our room and we spent the afternoon out at the pool and the highway noise really isn't bad. It isn't a silent or quiet location but really convenient to beaches shopping. Really enjoyed our stay here and we look forward to going back sometime.

While a convenient location, Hotel services were below sub par and some staff rather rude. Two days in a row, they had no milk, yogurt or cereal in the restaurant for breakfast. Also I called twice to inquire about my missing bonus points. The guy who answered, was very rude and hung up on me each time.

Summary Heading: Worst customer service… Shame on you Marriott
Summary: 1 star review based on customer service. Wish I could give it 0. Never actually stayed at the hotel. I booked our room for the 31st of this month for just one night back on 12/8. The room had a 24 hour cancellation. My entire family came down with covid this week. I called the hotel to cancel over 24 hours before our check in but was told I had prepaid for the room and they don’t do refunds. I argued and said no, I definitely would not book it that way. The “manager,” who I am confident was not actually a manager (he answered the phone and was the opposite of what I would consider a manager for Marriott to be,) was one of the rudest people I have ever had to deal with. Zero empathy for the fact that I am dealing with a sick family and an entire vacation cancelled. This trip was

Summary Heading: Wonderful Hotel, have a COVID suggestion
Summary: This is a wonderful hotel.   The staff is friendly and helpful.  The rooms are clean.   The breakfast tastes great.   However, I would suggest that breakfasts be taken to the rooms for consumption and perhaps served by staff instead of self-help. I stayed on a weekend and many families of older teens stay at this location. This demographic still has very low vaccination rates and while everyone was friendly, the breakfast room became over crowded. I would stay again, but might go to breakfast early or  eat take out if I needed to avoid potential exposure.

I planned a two night stay at this facility,  my plans change and the next morning at 6:00am I cancelled my reservation.  The desk clerk guarantee me that it had been cancelled with no problem.  He was very irritated with having to cancel the reservation.  It took nearly three weeks of trying to communicate with the hotel on charges to my account and after reaching Marriott directly, the hotel refunded 15% of my cancelled charge.  I would never recommend this hotel as it is very noisy being located right next to the freeway, but even more so because of their obvious uncooperative and unreliable staffing and management.  They never returned one of my calls on my inquires..

Summary Heading: Great property with poor customer service
Summary: With the pandemic going on I understand why the pool and breakfast were closed. It would have been nice for the hotel to take measures to allow people to do this.(E.g. Setting up time slots for using the hot tub, pool, or for breakfast). What REALLY made me frustrated was that I accidentally left a brand new, designer dress(tag still on) in the closet of my room. I realized this maybe a few days later and called the hotel week after week after week and they just acted like the dress disappeared into thin air. I still have the receipt for the dress and no compensation has been offered. Really frustrating and I will not be going back or recommending this hotel to anyone because of poor customer service.

Housekeeping and front desk staff were not wearing masks while working, and very few guests were not taking any visible precautions. Toilet paper roll in room was also partially used when we checked in. We booked three nights, but decided to leave after the first night. Hotel would not refund any potion of our stay.

Stayed for 4 nights - 2nd time in 4 months. Breakfast is decent, plenty of free parking. Conveniently right off interstate 5. However, we were on the south side of hotel and there was considerably more road noise than the 2nd time when we stayed on the north side. Beds were firm but comfortable for me. Bathrooms were fair size and overall cleanliness was good. Staff was friendly and helpful. Nothing fancy but good value.

Summary Heading: Four day visit in a fabulous family-friendly motel!
Summary: Excellent prices, right next to I-5, close to all shops and 1-1/2 hrs to San Diego. We booked the room on line and were pleasantly surprised with a wonderful  room, hot tub, pool and breakfasts.  The staff were outstanding as well.  Definitely will return.

If you are a light sleeper you will have problems at this hotel.  The walls are very thin and the doors exceptionally heavy and loud when they close/slam.  The first night people in the room across our hall had their door open and slam about 40x between 10-1030.  When I opened the door to see what in the heck was going on, they said they were moving rooms.  I could hear conversations in neighboring rooms.  Breakfast is blah - alot of things to choose from but all mediocre.
Manager Response: Dear garden78, Thank you for providing us with feedback about your experience with your recent stay with us. We would like to sincerely apologize for the disturbance as we understand how important it is to have a good nights rest. We hope to have a chance to make it right for you the next time you choose to stay with us.

Summary Heading: Clean, Good Breakfast, CLOSE to highway
Summary: I'd stay here if I had to.. which is what happened.  My reservation at a nearby hotel was cancelled.  This place is right off the highway, between a Gas station and a Carl's Restaurant.  You can hear the highway quite a bit at my end (Room 335).  The other side is a bit better, I think, but very light sleepers should beware.  As far as the rest- it's fine.  Safe, yes. Lots of people here, incuding other business travelers.  Internet is slow but good enought.  Very nice free breakfast - HOT eggs, sausage, make-your-own waffles, oatmeal, fresh fruit.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We do apologize about the freeway noise. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed the breakfast at our hotel. We hope the next time your travels bring you back to the area we can accommodate a room facing away from the freeway side.

Summary Heading: Saw all the great reviews but I am not one of them
Summary: I saw all the great reviews and thought this is perfect place to stay. It was close to family and friends which was a plus. Staff was friendly which is another plus. The rest is based on the room and the complimentary breakfast. My room was not good. I was put in a room where one wall was elevator noise and another wall was maids room. It sounded like there was a washing machine in there. It sounded like I could hear the spin cycle. If the ac wasn’t on I could hear the freeway noise as well  I don’t understand why they choose to put customers in that room. The other disappointment was their complimentary breakfast. I’ve stayed in many places where they serve breakfast and this was just blah and there was no where to sit so I had to take my food back to my room. I only went down

Summary Heading: Excellent place to stay in Mission Viejo
Summary: My sister Ellie and I stayed one night to enjoy nearby hiking.  Alberto directed us to the perfect spot!  It was a fantastic hike with a trailhead known only to locals.  We really appreciated his helpfulness, and he and the other friendly staff really made our stay. We will definitely stay here again.  We also loved the convenient location.
Manager Response: Dear JudyWalton, We are thrilled to hear that your enjoyed your stay and had a great time checking out the local terrain of Mission Viejo. It was a pleasure having you stay with us!

Summary Heading: Affordable,quiet, comfortable and near the beaches via I-5
Summary: Stayed here 4 nights the weekend of OHANA fest and drove to and from the festival location at Dana Point via the San Diego freeway. The hotel is very nice and affordable compared to similar places on the beaches. Great hot breakfast!  Very nice desk staff- helpful. Highly recommended and will definitely stay again.

We were meeting and staying over at this hotel for a few days, so it's location (just off the freeway) was great and easy to access.  The staff and accommodations were so nice for the reasonable price we paid for our rooms! Would definitely stay here again if visiting the area.
Manager Response: Dear Ruth F, Thank you for staying with us! We are thrilled to hear that our location suits your need and we hope to see you again in the near future whenever travel brings you back to the Mission Viejo area! Have a wonderful day.

Summary: Stayed here while playing a senior softball tournament in San Clemente. The hotel rates in San Clemente were ridiculous. This hotel was about 15 minutes away. I cannot think of any negatives about this place. Front desk staff were very friendly. Great pillows and mattresses. There was NO freeway noise.  Shower had good pressure. TV was a little smaller than most, but no big deal.  Breakfast was great with plenty of choices. Very easy on and off freeway. Will definitely stay here next year. The negative reviews are unfounded.

It was a very pleasant surprise to have the place so conveniently located to my business purposes in Mission Viejo. Easy on, easy off I-5. The best part has been the quality of the property and the excellence of the service.

Super friendly service. Rooms are clean and well decorated. I love the working desk with plenty of plug-ins. Decent breakfast. Free wifi TV and plenty of free parking. Safe neighborhood but not ideal for walking around due to the freeway proximity (there are a few shops within walking distance).  Rooms facing and overlooking the freeway is bright but a little noisy (to be expected).  I'm sure it would have been fine at night after hours but I switched to the other side as I had to work. Traffic noise is minimal but the room is darker.  Extra bonus: shampoo, conditioner, and shower gel were in refillable bottles (not the small disposable ones). Shower pressure are perfect. Comfortable bed with plenty of pillows.

Summary Heading: The best hotel in Mission Viejo
Summary: The Fairfield Inn is an older, well-maintained property centrally located. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast is provided; a cut above in quality from most hotels. Room is comfortable, great TV, restful beds and plenty of towels. Shuttle available for travel within five miles of hotel. Outside pool perfect for al fresco lunch — no restaurant but a good burger joint next door and two convenience stores an easy walk. We've been here for nine nights and highly recommend.

Summary Heading: Good Medium Price Hotel - Oso Parkway and I-5
Summary: I stayed here the night after staying at a marginal Hampton Inn in Santa Ana.  Difference was night and day - much better quality hotel, better quality room, better quality anything and much less expensive (some of which is due to location).    All in all a good solid hotel.  I'd stay here again.

We stayed here for 2 nights to attend a wedding at the golf course.  It’s a very basic inn... that’s a little dated.  Decor is old & it’s in need of an update.  Room was very small with a tiny bathroom.  Good location... but it’s not very nice.  I probably would not stay here again.

Summary: The Fairfield Inn in Mission Viejo has an excellent location, just off Route 5, which makes many of the Orange County attractions easily accessible . Despite its proximity to a major highway, it’s surprisingly quiet. The staff, mainly young, was friendly and obliging, and the room was clean. We especially appreciated the excellent firm mattress. But the room was also small and a bit austere – décor consisted of one miniscule print. The bathroom was small too, and could have used more counter space around the sink as well as better ventilation.   The Inn has a pleasant outdoor pool and a somewhat cramped fitness center. The room rate includes a complimentary breakfast – all right, although several of the hot items were pretty cold.   Overall impression: not wonderful, not

Summary: Well located from freeway, however for a quiet room choose one by the parking lot (preferably not on the first floor). There was the usual breakfast and despite a crowd there was sufficient seating. One member of our party was in a wheelchair, however, and the mirror in their presumably assessable bathroom was too high to be seen from the wheelchair. These little details make a difference.  Coffee and iced water available in the lobby.

This place is pretty cool you get a breakfast buffet and you can take an easy Uber ride down to Laguna Beach the staff was very nice and helpful. It's kind of in a weird spot hard to see from the freeway but it is behind two gas stations

Summary Heading: Good place to spend a few days when visiting the area
Summary: We went to a wedding in Laguna Niguel and could not find a reasonable priced hotel. We found this one and it was not very far. The commute back and forth was not an issue. We Uber a couple of times and it was around $28 each way. The rooms were very clean and the beds were comfortable. The air conditioning worked great. The breakfast was good they had scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, waffles, cereals, yogurt, and oatmeal along with juices and coffee. The Check in and out were fast and easy.
Manager Response: Dear Daniel H,   Thank you for choosing the Fairfield Inn Mission Viejo Orange County for your recent travels to Mission Viejo. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay! It is so encouraging to hear such positive feedback.   It was a pleasure to have you here with us and we hope you choose to create more memories with us whenever your travels bring you back to Mission Viejo.   Sincerely, Cecile S. Guest Relations Manager Fairfield Mission Viejo

Summary: Stay at this property was a let down. I stayed for 4 nights and on each of these days (sometimes during multiple times a day) the room key malfunctioned.   Front desk staff lacked the basic courtesy to acknowledge the problem. Instead, I was re-issued the room key every time I reported the issue. It literally happened 5 times on one single day of my stay. I had to make multiple trips to the room and back to front desk.   Unless you are up for an ordeal. AVOID!!!
Manager Response: Dear Himanshu M,   Thank you for taking the time to comment on your recent stay at the Fairfield Inn Mission Viejo. I would like to offer my sincere apology for the less than enjoyable stay you had at our hotel.   I understand that every guest expects a comfortable and hassle free stay. Please believe me that your experience certainly does not in any way represent the quality of standards we strive to, and indeed customarily maintain at the Fairfield Inn - Mission Viejo. I hope you can accept our deepest apologies for the inconvenience as the service and explanation given at the front desk was insufficient.   There are a few possible reasons for the deactivation of a room key. I'm not sure if this was the case for you, but for most of our guests, they keep their hotel key cards in their pocket or purse next to their cell phone. Doing so exposes the magnetic strip of the key card to the magnetic fields of the cell phone, degrading the encoding.That said, I'm sorry the front desk was not more helpful in helping you resolve the issue.   Once again, we apologize for the inconvenience. I can assure you that I have personally addressed your comments with the hotel's front desk manager for corrective action.   Sincerely, CECILE SEATO Guest Relations Manager  Fairfield Mission Viejo  Cecile.Seato@marriott.com (949) 582-3287

Summary: We needed a hotel convenient to the freeway and family, the Fairfield Inn on Oso Parkway fit the bill perfectly. Rooms were clean, friendly staff, nice open lobby lots of tables and chairs, breakfast was good too.

This is a very clean hotel with a very friendly staff. The down side is the noise, many groups of young athletes were visiting, for a baseball tournament....Just be prepared for kids running down the hall....Although close to the freeway and a busy road I did not have an issue.

Summary Heading: Impressed! Nice lobby and breakfast area, too.
Summary: Two nights stay here. The property is very clean, and well appointed. The staff was helpful. I enjoyed the breakfast too. The rooms were meticulous. The elevator was slow, though. Still, in all...a nice Marriott property!

Summary Heading: It is a very clean hotel with great service.
Summary: This is a very clean hotel with a very friendly staff. The breakfast is very good with a selection that varies slightly from day to day. There was scrambled eggs, cheese omelets, Canadian bacon, turkey sausage and regular sausage, make your own waffles and all the regular cereals and bread. Overall the selection was good. The staff was particularly helpful and friendly. The down side is the noise, nestled between a freeway and a busy road. I actually prefer the freeway side as the noise is a constant hum and diminishes at night. The road side is loud with cars accelerating at the light and seem to go on very late. This is probably not for the noise sensitive person.

Summary Heading: Consistent quality for a Fairfield Inn
Summary: This was a 4 night stay for business. Initially I was a bit put off by the location - tucked behind two gas stations off a parkway and surrounded by busy streets/highway. But, I got over it quickly - the hotel is well-appointed and the rooms are very quiet and clean. Breakfast is your average hotel buffet - predictable and nothing special - but gets the job done. Staff were very friendly. Very nice outdoor pool area and exercise room. Not much around that you can walk to -  but found 2 good restaurants that are walkable - Wineworks and Dublin Pub. Refrigerator in each room. Can get extra Marriott points if you defer housekeeping. WiFi is good and parking is free.

This is the second year in a row that we have stayed at the Fairfield hotel for a work event. Once again, it met our expectations and offered a comfortable stay for our group.  The hotel is is perfectly located next to I-5. Easy, quick access to anywhere. However, you would never know you are right next to a highway. The hotel is quiet. The hotel seems to be big with business travelers for this reason.  The hotel is very nice and clean. The staff is very friendly. Breakfast offers a nice spread. The fitness room is great for this type of hotel. Just remember to turn the AC on when you go in. I think they turn it off when no one is in there (which I completely understand), but it took a really hot workout for me to think to check if the air was on.  The rooms are great, clean and

This hotel was ok.   The lobby area is nicely decorated.   The front lobby staff are nice.   There were not 'recycle' trash cans in the room. As California is very strict on what you can throw out, I was very surprised we did not have a recycle container in the room.   The breakfast option was very good. Busy, but good. For guests who are not businessman / woman traveling I wish they would have the breakfast open later than 9am during the week.  I don't want to be in the business man / woman's way when trying to get my breakfast, and that's how I felt, as I was in their way.    The hotel room was your standard hotel room with two beds. The TV in the room was very small, maybe 36". The bathroom counter top was very small, we barely had enough room for two of us to use the
Manager Response: Dear Heather629,   Thank you for taking the time to comment on your recent at the Fairfield Inn Mission Viejo. I appreciate your concern, interest and the extra time you have taken to bring these matters to my attention.   I agree wholeheartedly with your feedback regarding the need to have recycling bins in our rooms. Rest assured that your feedback has been noted and we will work on implementing that as soon as possible. It's always encouraging to hear positive feedback and I'm excited to hear that you liked our breakfast options. That said, I apologize that it felt crowded during breakfast. It is hotel standard to keep breakfast open for a timeframe of 3 hours, but as a courtesy we do try to keep breakfast open for at least an extra 30 minutes. The next time you stay with us, please feel free to take your time during breakfast. In regards to our TV size, counterpace, and hotel location, we do apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations.   Once again, thank you for your valued feedback and we hope we have a chance to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Mission Viejo.   Sincerely, CECILE SEATO Guest Relations Manager Fairfield Mission Viejo  Cecile.Seato@marriott.com (949) 582-3287

Summary: The front desk staff are great. The room was spacious and very clean.  The housekeeper was excellent. The free breakfast was just average. It is in a great location and close to shopping and many restaurants.

Summary Heading: Freeway noise very LOUD, Stay away if you are light sleeper, NO SECURITY in the hotel
Summary: I was one of the unfortunate people who got stuck here for 4 nights. Was just here this past weekend on a 4 day weekend. Got a king size room on the 5th floor facing the freeway. The freeway noise coming in through the window was unbearable (it sounds like the window is open but window is shut). It is really bad i had to call the front desk at 9:30pm (trying to sleep) to get transferred to another room away from the freeway. the front desk gave us another king size room above the front entrance on the 5th floor and the noise level is the same as the first room we got. I just got fed up with it and decided to just stick with the 2nd room and was able to do a work around. Summary Heading: Staff goes above and beyond to make this resort a five rating.  Comfortable and accommodating
Summary: Everyone worked so hard to assist me with my every need and the staff was exceptional!  Pool and jacuzzi clean and relaxing.  Reluctant when I first arrived and overly pleased extending my stay an additional night.  Hotel is conveniently located off route 5 and plenty of stores and restaurants nearby!

Summary Heading: Clean, quiet, excellent staff, delicious breakfast!
Summary: The moment you walk into the lobby you can see and smell the cleanliness of this hotel.  The lobby is welcoming and has coffee and water available at all hours.  The staff is so professional and helpful.  Our room was clean and quiet...hint...room 401 has no neighbors...it is so nice and quiet.  The breakfast was hot and delicious...there is a wide variety of options each day.  The beds and pillows are very comfortable I had no trouble sleeping here.  The access on and off the freeway is so easy.  Don't let the closeness to the freeway worry you, we did not hear any freeway noise in our room!

Summary Heading: Great for week long visits with grandkids
Summary: We have been booking this hotel for years now as we live on the opposite coast of this country. Since there is no room at the next generations' home, we make our home here for the week long or longer visits to see grandkids.  Close to their baseball fields,  school, restaurants, shopping, etc. We eat a good breakfast, spend all day and evening with family, then retire each evening in our own bed.  Perfect for us! Clean hotel, accommodating staff, and a variety of foods for breakfast.

My granddaughter and I stayed one night for a quick college apartment/roommate review.  The hotel was very clean.  Breakfast was good. The hotel was undergoing room renovation.  Our room had already been redone with very nice modular units...very business oriented.  The closet would be a bit small for more than 2 or 3 days but didn't affect us.  Our only  complaint would be the mattress.  I don't  think they were replaced/upgraded.  It felt like cardboard over springs.  But in my direct hotel review, the manager has already responded and implied that the mattress issue would be addressed.   Be aware... the entrance access is easy to miss as the driveway is located between two gas stations just off I5.

We apologize about your experience with our beds and we hope that whenever travel brings your back to Mission Viejo you will give us another chance.

Summary Heading: Hidden but clean, nice staff, good breakfast, quiet, quick access to highway.
Summary: I found this hotel to be a great value. Very quiet, close highway access, great staff and breakfast. No issues and typical/consistent Fairfield experience. Walking distance to pub next door and other restaurants a short drive or walk away.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the fantastic comments about your stay at Fairfield Inn Marriott Hotel in Mission Viejo! Summary Heading: Great stay for business or families.
Summary: Very well kept and clean property.  I am here on business for two months.  It is nice that they offer free internet, free breakfast, free printing, free computers in their free business center.  I stress the word FREE because other places charge for such amenities.  The staff here has been consistently courteous and friendly.  Shout out to JD, Zack and Maria for going out of their way to make sure I was comfortable while staying here.  Conveniently located near Laguna Hills, Laguna Niguel and Mission Viejo right off the 5 freeway.

The staff was nice and everything was very clean. I found the room layout to be crowded and the bathroom door awkward. There was a bad smell coming from drain in the sink. For the price breakfast was good as well as the location. Two gas stations next to hotel and Carl's Jr and Green Burrito within walking distance. Would stay again.

Summary Heading: Perfect for Doheny Blues Festival 11 miles - straight shot
Summary: Clean, well decorated but small rooms. Comfortable bed. EASY location, right between the 5 freeway and the onramp to the freeway. Well priced, good continental breakfast and free wifi included. At the front desk's suggestion, opted for a first floor room. Did not hear any noise. Convenient in and out. Free parking. Nice pool.

The hallways smell like bubble gum or some type of car wash cleaner... shower door opens to the outside of the room which was a little odd and if you're tall, get ready to dip down to shower as the shower head is low. We took a short uber ride into Capistrano which was a great way to spend the evening. Very close to a lot of restaurants and sights. Overall good place, safe, quite and Good staff.

I was scheduled for back surgery, and this Fairfield Inn was listed as being close to both the surgery center and the surgeon's office. We live about 3 hrs away, so drove down the day before for my pre-op with the surgeon. At the surgery center, after being prepped and waiting about an hour, the surgeon came in with the bad news that a critical piece of equipment needed for my procedure was missing. Summary: I planned this stop for my wife & me since we were going to visit friends living nearby. When turning right (south) at that sign the driver will need to proceed BETWEEN the Circle K and Chevron gas stations and drive down the hill to the entrance of the hotel.  Should the driver fail to make that first turn from Oso Parkway, there is a "side entrance" drive if one turns into

Hotel was right off the freeway with easy access on and off. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The breakfast has a wide variety of food to eat that was tasty. The rooms were very clean and updated.

Fairfield Inns are all pretty much the same--what set them apart is the staff.  The staff was outstanding!! Each and everyone of them from the General Manager Moe to the housekeeping fulfilled requests promptly and with a smile.  Everyone went out of their way to not only make you feel comfortable, but welcome.  Between being in a convenient location and outstanding value it can't be beat!!

The first impression of this hotel, which is a remodeled  Hampton Inn, is: "Wow--these ceilings are really low!" Like about 7 feet 4 inches in the lobby and common area. For a tall person like me, that's uncomfortable and oppressive. Room was okay--a bit on the small/crowded side. I like Fairfield for a value brand, but I'd look elsewhere when coming back to this area.

Summary: The hotel is convenient to I 5.  The room was comfortable and clean.  Two gas station/convenience stores next door.  Best breakfast we have ever had at a chain that offers free breakfast.  The lobby could have used more cleaning after a ball team stayed and tracked dirt on the floor.  GM assured me that sort of thing will not happen again.

This hotel is right off the freeway - making it an easy stop for someone driving thru.  The check in was quick!    Our room was a little on the small side, but had nice decor and was very clean.  The bed was very comfortable.  We thought we would hear a lot of freeway noise in our room, but it was pleasantly pretty quiet.  The sink was outside the bathroom making getting ready while someone was in the shower a breeze.  The bathroom like the bedroom was very, very clean.  There is ample parking and it is free!  I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Great location just off 5, quiet, clean, good guality. Breakfast is really good-fresh & variety. Zack at front desk goes above what is expected for excellent customer service.  Room a little too small but dooable. Strange entrench bit plenty of parking

This place was accommodating and quiet despite its location smack in the middle of a cloverleaf onto busy Highway 5 in Orange County. Not an easy one to find since you drive into the gas station parking lot to get there. You can see it, just can't reach it.   Despite all that, a nice stay, good breakfast, all the necessary amenities (no more...), clean and an easily-accessible, fully functioning business center. Slept well too on soft down pillows.
Manager Response: Dear SAEMom25 Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback on regards to your recent stay at the Fairfield Inn Mission Viejo Orange County.  Please accept our sincere apologies for all the inconveniences and difficulties you went  thru in finding our location at the same time I am very happy that you were able to enjoy your stay,as well I do appreciate the good comments.   thank you for your valued feedback and we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Mission Viejo.

Summary: I stayed here for two nights.  I'm a local but had family staying here.  Carlos at the front desk is a delight.  Very sweet and also remembered my name.  Breakfast was okay, could be better.  The orange juice tasted like water and powder.  Rooms were clean and I loved the bathroom products.  Would definitely recommend if you're looking for something cheap and can get past the orange and green.

Summary Heading: Quiet hotel nestled between two gas stations next to the 5.
Summary: Despite being hidden behind the gas stations, this Fairfield Inn is quite easy to find- and surprisingly quiet. If you read my other reviews, you'll understand that quiet accommodations are the most important hotel room attribute.   Mission Viejo is not a top tourist destination so hotel choices are slim. I stayed here while visiting some old friends. Much to their dismay, I decided not to stay at their house because of the noise level - dogs and too many guests. I remember sleeping peacefully and not being woken in the morning with the maid knocking on the door.   The reception staff was friendly and always greeted me as I entered and exited. I had no problems checking in.   Breakfast was typical Fairfield Inn with hot and cold cereals, fruits, waffles and eggs. The dining
Manager Response: Dear EvaTheDragon,  Thank you for writing a review about your stay with us. Summary: Although our stay was short, it was wonderful from check-in to check-out. Parking was free and front desk staff was very efficient, thorough and friendly. The room was super clean with nice bedding, lots of pillows, and thick fluffy towels in the bathroom. The free wifi worked great.  The complimentary breakfast included a variety of hot and cold items: eggs, potatoes, waffles, bacon, sausage, bagels, danishes, muffins, yogurt, coffee etc... Will definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Good location for Laguna Niguel, Mission Viejo area.
Summary: This is one of the few mid-priced hotels in the Laguna Niguel, Mission Viejo area.  It is usually well-booked, both weekdays and weekends.  Staff is very helpful, parking is ample, location is very convenient, though oddly tucked back behind two gas stations.  Even with Marriott Gold I was not given my preferential room, and was located right across from the elevator.  Did allow me to have a 4pm checkout with Gold status, which was nice.

Good basic room, better than others in the area. Sound proofing between floors almost non-existent (or else there were hippo's in the room above!) Great location for my needs. Passed on the "breakfast" - hit a local diner and you will be much happier.

I found the room to be comfortable but the breakfast and the dining area to eat were pretty bad and way overcrowded. Good value for the price and close to my family. Would recommend this, however it is close to freeway so you have to watch which room you get.

Summary: Fairfield Inn by Marriott Mission Viejo Orange County – Tel: 949-582-7100 This is the second year I visited this establishment when I attended a Greek festival in San Juan Capistrano on Saturday, September 24, 2016 for a one night stay.  To no Surprise, it was even better than a year ago. I requested an early arrival check in and no problem as they had a room available, the front desk representative by the name of Katie that greeted me upon arrival was helpful, friendly with a beautiful smile and with outstanding customer service skills. As a matter of fact all staff were friendly and helpful. The room was clean as well as the bathroom, as well as the entire establishment was outstandingly clean. The breakfast that they served at no additional charge had a variety of choices.

My parents and I stayed here for a long weekend and we loved it. The rooms were a decent size, beds were very comfortable and the entire property itself was very clean. We got in kind of late but nonetheless the young man at the front desk was very kind and professional. He went out of his way to try to personalize the checking in process for us rather than just push us through the process. Pretty average breakfast with a wide selection of hot teas to choose from. My only complaints would be that the side of the property facing the freeway is pretty loud, even during the night, but a good way to get around that would to simply request a room on the other side. Overall a wonderful place. Will definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Hello Kristen,  I would like to thank you for your feedback and review of our hotel. If there is anything we can do to make your possible future stays more accommodating, please feel free to contact us at any time. Thank you! Sincerely, Zach C.

Summary Heading: Good location, excellent breakfast, but too much freeway noise
Summary: Spent two night at the Fairfield Inn at the end of August 2016.  Very pleasant people at the front desk and excellent breakfast.  Rooms are minimal, but very clean.  Bathroom door was always in the way-strange room design.  Our room was very close to the freeway (south end of the building) and very noisy even at 4am.
Manager Response: Hello DoctorJoe_12,  We have received and read your review, and we appreciate your valued feedback. In the future, if you decide to stay at our property again, please do not hesitate to inform our staff  when you check in that you prefer rooms on the other side of the building. and myself or my co workers will do our best to place you in a room that best meets your needs and requests.   Thank you for your review and we hope to see you again in the future! Sincerely, Zach C.

Summary: Conveniently located right off the highway. Just a quick and easy 20 minute drive to Laguna Beach. Very clean. Friendly front desk staff. Great continental breakfast.   The only complaint (minor) was the shower curtain. It's so thin that the water goes right through and somewhat floods the bathroom. Easy fix.
Manager Response: Hello Melanie,  We have received and read your feedback of our hotel, and we are glad to hear that most of your stay was excellent and up to our standards. Front Desk Supervisor 949 582 7100

Summary: I just got done staying at the Fairfield Inn with my family over Labor Day weekend. We were in town for my son's soccer tournament and the team stayed at this hotel. All of us drove in from Phoenix and the first night we were there three of the cars got broken into right in the parking lot. One of them was right in front of the main door. All three of the cars were Suburbans and the thieves stole their backseats. Apparently this happens all the time and the hotel was extremely matter of fact about it as if they didn't care at all. Luckily our care didn't get broken into but it caused everyone to have anxiety the rest of the weekend. The rooms were small and below average. The elevator takes forever. Do not stay here if you can help it.

The location is pretty convenient due to its proximity to the freeway, which was also rather noisy because it's so close. The one negative here is the ancient and scary elevators. Turns out they did that all the time, and God help you if the elevator was full of people, which made the bouncing even worse. Easy to fine right off highway 5. Ask for a room on the mountain side for a nice view

Summary: Located off the freeway which is very convenient plus 2 gas stations in front of the hotel. Another exit down the road is a nice shopping mall.  The room was basic with tv, iron, iron board. Bathroom a bit small but good. Breakfast was ok with nothing special. Overall was a good stay.

Summary Heading: Average, but poor lighting in bathroom
Summary: The room was clean and the air conditioning worked well.  The included breakfast was generous.  However, I was there with my teen daughter and both of us felt the lightening in the bathroom was inadequate, making it difficult to apply makeup.  There was a large mirror in the hallway, but there was no light there.  Kind of unusual to not have an overhead light in the hallway.
Manager Response: Dear Linda G  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts regarding this issue. We appreciate you bringing it to our attention. We will share your message appropriately within the organization.   Sincerely,  Moe K.

Summary Heading: Good hotel for cheap business travel
Summary: The room was nice and clean. The AC was great because it was 96 degrees out. The shower had a great shower head with good power. The staff were nice and very professional. The breakfast was typical cheaper hotel breakfast with eggs and bacon and waffles. The pool is nice and small but clean.

Three of us spent one night. I downloaded the Marriott app on my phone and was able to "check in" and tell them we would be arriving sometime after 10pm. I was in doubt they'd have a top floor room since the parking lot was pretty full, but that wasn't a problem at all. Grabbed a cup of lemon water and hot chamomile tea before heading up the elevator. Put on the air and all was quiet, just how I like it.  Breakfast was buffet style scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes, make your own waffle, cereal, coffee, etc. Front desk folk were very nice and helpful..    Beds for two people a little on the small size, but  they are advertised as double, not queen which I was aware of. Bathroom nice and clean, real bath towels are always a plus, and plenty of hot water for the shower. All in all,

Stayed here overnight. Family member at nearby hospital in Mission Viejo having surgery.  One stop north on the freeway. The room was comfortable and clean. The staff was very helpful and recommended a nearby restaurant that was talking distance and fantastic! Highly recommend eating at with Wneworks or Dublin 4. The complimentary  breakfast at Fairfield Inn was basic and included a good selection of items. The Inn's sign is obvious from the freeway but finding the entrance is tricky. Enter in-between the gas stations.

After commuting back and forth from San Diego where we had a condo, my husband and I moved north to Mission Viejo so that we could be right in the same town as our children and granddaughter. Fairfield Inn is right off the freeway and a straight shot to our kids home. We didn't get lost! Driving was simple, shopping was convenient the hotel is beautiful, immaculate and well run.  Employees are friendly and helpful and even though the building is right off the freeway and main exits and 4 lane roads it is relatively protected from noise by beautiful trees and foliage. Oh, and breakfast was ample!

Summary Heading: best place to stay for many many reasons.. food location staff rooms service and more
Summary: the rooms are amzing and have everything you need clean bathroom and white spa towerls amazing breakfast helpful staff computer room exercise room  all requests we made were honored great shampoo and soap that you dont have to pack it saves time and money

I think I have went soft about hotel rooms. Everything is ok but nothing special. I wish the rooms had a mini fridge and the facility had laundry machines. The room decor looks old but it's always clean.

I chose this hotel because I was visiting relatives who live in Leguna Niguel and this was very convenient to their home.  I was pleased with my accommodations. I got the AAA rate and it averaged $100 per night which was reasonable for the area.   I spent 4 nights and had a room with 2 beds.  Rooms were clean and had the usual amenities.  There was really no view from my room - overlooked the parking lot.  The hotel is very convenient to the highway.  It is set back behind a gas station so you have to look carefully to find the driveway, but the traffic lights make it easy to cross the wide road when entering and leaving.  There is a complimentary breakfast with all the usual offerings for this type of establishment  (apples for fresh fruit, yogurt, dry cereal, bagels, other

Recently spent 3 days at the property.  It was convenient to the highway, very clean and the staff was very helpful and pleasant.  would definitely stay at the location again and do recommend it if you are in the area.

I frequently stay at the Fairfield Inn Mission Viejo for business travel and the staff there is excellent and friendly.  Imelda personally handles my room reservations, Melanie, Connor and the rest of the front desk personnel are very professional and helpful with the check-in, check-out process as well as answering any questions I might have.  Diana does an excellent job with the morning breakfast providing a clean environment with warm fresh food.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay near expensive area
Summary: Many hotels nearer to Orange County airport and the Irvine area are pretty expensive, so this was a nice place to stay for a couple of days.  The price is reasonable for the area, and the location makes it easy to get to Irvine and other central Orange County locations in a matter of 20 to 25 minutes (longer with traffic on the I-405).    A couple of suggestions for those from out of town and/or with rental cars.  STAY OFF THE TOLL ROADS and SPEEDY (TOLL) LEFT LANES on many freeways in Orange County.  Your GPS may lead you onto a toll road, so watch out for that if you don't want a potential big bill, since your rental car may not have the electronic pass to pay.  Also, it may be easier to travel east from the Fairfield using the Ortega Highway (74) than to try I-91 at rush

We arrived very late due to traveling but was greeted by a friendly and courteous staff member. Very informative and reminded us that breakfast the next morning would be crowded because it would be a Saturday. Room was fine, a little warm because the a/c turned off and on. Bed was comfy and pillows were just like I like them, firm. Went to breakfast early as suggested and was surprised at how much Fairfield offered. That had a waffle bar, two types of eggs, toast, danishes, fruit, bacon, hashbrowns and juices. Few different types of milk for cereals...yogurts. You really couldn't go wrong.  Try out the pool. It's Salt water!  No complaints here.

I am a Marriott Gold Rewards member.  I checked in for a week visit. Was given a room on the back, far end of the hotel, right above the I-5. Traffic noise all night long as the I-5 is NEVER quiet. Black-out curtains blocked light but not noise. The door fit so poorly in the doorframe that you could read from the light in the hallway and of course every sound in the hall came right through the gaps in the door. I asked several times at the front desk to speak to the general manager and was told he was not available. After I got belligerent I finally spoke to Gisela Barrera (Front Desk Manager) and she was 'surprised' to hear my complaints. I had been told by front desk staff the General Manager wasn't available and wouldn't be in that day at all. After speaking with the Front
Manager Response: Dear Ron B, Thank you for choosing to stay with us during your recent visit to Mission Viejo CA I am truly sorry that we did not meet your expectations on the room location during your stay. I am glad I was able to speak and apologized myself with you as soon as I was notified about your concerns. Once again please accept my sincere apologies for the unhappy stay that you experienced during your stay with us. as I had promised you no room charges were made for the last night of your stay. I have shared this with all the appropriate team in effort to improve our Guest experiences. Please excuse us for the miscommunication on regards the General Manager hours, Unfortunately his work hours are different each day but He is in the property Monday thru Friday. I am also here early in the morning as well on weekends to assist our Guest and make their stay happy. Once again excuse us for all the unhappy stay. If your travels brings you back to Mission Viejo Please give us another opportunity to assist you better. Thank you for your loyalty to Marriott and also thank you for been part of our valuable customers.  Warm regards,

Summary Heading: Very Small Rooms with Huge Furniture
Summary: As others have mentioned, the road to this hotel goes right between two gas stations.  The name of the road is Fairfield so it isn't too hard to find if you know what you are looking for.  If you aren't aware the entrance to the hotel is easy to miss.  The lobby area of the hotel was nicely decorated and welcoming.  Coffee, tea and cocoa are available in the lobby 24 hours.  The rooms in this hotel are very small and in need of new furniture.  They include a huge cabinet that is the wardrobe/closet, dresser and holds the TV  (on a slide out tray - very old school).  When the TV is slid out the space to walk between the TV and foot of the bed is reduced to about 12". This piece of cabinetry was probably 6’W x 7’T x 2’D so it took up a lot of the available visual space on that
Manager Response: Dear AGoingGal,  Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We take matters such as this very seriously.  As a result, please allow us some time to look into this matter further.   Sincerely,  Fairfield Inn Mission Viejo 949-582-7100

Summary: Spent two weeks here over the holidays to be close to family. Clean, comfortable and quiet even though just off I-5.  Many shopping and restaurant choices close by. Friendly, helpful staff with basic hot breakfast choices daily.  Since hotel choices are very limited in this area, this is a wise selection.

Summary Heading: Contemporary design, clean well kept lodging and perfect for business travelers.
Summary: I stay at this hotel about once per month for a business trip.  They have the friendliest check in staff (some of whom know my name, the rest usually recognize my face).  They have a nice breakfast and free parking at a very reasonable price. There are similar hotels along the 241 corridor but if your business is along the 5 freeway, the 241 is too far away with way too much traffic.    During one trip in the summer I noticed that the A/C didn't seem to be cooling off.  It wasn't unbearable so I stopped at the front desk the next morning to ask them to check into it.  When I returned later that day, the room was cool and the repairman left a note to call the front desk if there were any issues (there weren't).  For a reasonably priced hotel, this one offers very nice service.

Summary Heading: Clean, convenient, good staff, but dated
Summary: While the hotel appears to have been updated since some of the pictures were posted here, it really is dated. Two things specifically - there are no additional outlets provided by the beds. They actually have extension cords for the clock and lamp, so you can find a spot, but it's not really convenient. Then only one outlet available at the desk area. And, the enhanced internet (upcharge if not gold/platinum) is incredibly slow. The television service also lagged at times (hear sound, but the picture is stuck). The only other real issue was that even with trying to ensure that the shower curtain was against the shower wall, the shower leaked heavily. It is a bit odd driving between two gas stations to get to the hotel - it is not a street, but the access to the gas stations.
Manager Response: Dear Falcarragh13  Thank you for writing a review about your previus stay with us. We strive very hard to make each and every guest's stay perfect, however, it appears we fell short of our goal during your visit. We would like to apologize for falling short of your expectations regarding our outlets in the rooms and Internet. We also regret the issues you had with our Televison. In spite of these, we are pleased to know that you found our staff to be nice specially during the breakfast time. We give the utmost importance to our guest comments as they help us improve, and continually provide the best guest experience possible. In addition, your feedback has been forwarded to all of our management to ensure similar situations can be avoided in the future.  Again, our apologies for the inconvenience and we hope to have another opportunity to provide you a much better experience.

Summary: CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! The hotel staff is very knowledgeable, caring, and considerate. They are very friendly and very helpful. The Complimentary breakfast is very good. The rooms are very clean and the beds are very confortable. I feel Gisela and the whole staff really go the extra mile every time.

We were in town for Christmas to visit family. This is a clean hotel and easy access to I-5. The staff was great and very helpful. It came with breakfast which was good and hot. The rooms are clean and quiet even though it is close to the highway. We will stay here again.

Summary Heading: Very Good Hotel for Price and Location. A hidden gem.
Summary: Based on the location, I was initially unsure on this hotel. After all, you have to drive through two gas stations to get there. After arriving at our room, it was fresh, clean and quiet. The breakfast area was clean and had a very good spread. The fitness room was surprisingly large and clean. Absolutely no complaints here and they can probably even charge more.  This is a hidden gem.

Imelda was extremely conscientious, considerate, knowledgeable, and pleasant!  She assisted us in changing rooms, gave us great recommendations for restaurants and movie theatres, and was extremely congenial.  We thoroughly enjoyed doing business with her.  She is a terrific representative for the hotel!

Summary Heading: Great location.  Close to activities.  Very Clean
Summary: We used the Fairfield for a 1-night stay.  The first thing that we noticed was that the room was very clean.  Since watching "Hotel Impossible" we have become much more aware of the cleaning deficiencies in many hotels.  This place could be used as an example of how to maintain a property correctly.  The "free" breakfast was very complete and all of the food was served at the correct temperature.  The front desk crew always greeted us upon entering and that is becoming very rare these days.  The shower had awesome water pressure. always a plus.  The only reason that I did not give it an excellent rating is due to a lot of road noise coming into the room because it is located very close to a major  freeway (Interstate 5) and the fact that the elevator was located next to the room

I do not normally expect a lot from a Fairfield Inn and I was surprised at how accommodating the staff and service was at this property. Check in was friendly, professional and quick. They put me in a room away from the interstate and it was an easy enjoyable experience. The room was clean and well appointed. Air conditioning was effective and quiet.  One small note. Parking fills up so you may have a little walk and the hotel is located behind a Carl's Jr and Gas Station so a little hard to locate if you are not paying attention.  I will definately use this property again if in the area for business.  Great Stay!

Summary Heading: Good place - but avoid certain rooms
Summary: I stay at this location anywhere from 3-5 times a year and have done so for the past 3 years. I've stayed in rooms on various floors. This time I was put in room 135. I highly recommend avoiding this room. It is directly across from an electrical closet and near an exterior door to the building. I am not sure if it was employees coming in and out of the electrical closet OR guests coming and going through the exterior building door but this room was noisy! In the future I'll definitely stick with rooms from the exterior doors! Based on previous experience stay away from pool side/highway side, elevator and ice machines. It is a nice hotel. I recommend it but avoid these areas and you'll enjoy it more.   I also want to mention the manager. Each time I've stayed I've seen the same

I stayed here for about a week since my house had flood damage.  This hotel is pretty good.  The staff was nice, the lobby was nice and big, and they offered breakfast.  The breakfast consisted of scrambled eggs and bacon or sausage (they had different items every day), your typical continental breakfast items such as coffee and pastries, cereal, yogurt, and a make-you-own waffle station.  The room was average but clean and well maintained.  Overall, this was a nicely priced hotel room that fit our needs.  We would definately stay here again in the future.

The hotel is right next to the freeway and while the location is a bit funky (behind gas stations) the staff is excellent. Very helpful staff with good suggestions on restaurants.  The hotel breakfast was average at best for Fairfield Inns and could be improved a bit. Great size room and bathroom and despite being right by a busy freeway I did not notice any traffic noise.

Decent place with a great location.  Clean and friendly, amenities are average at best.  It's a Fairfield so you get what you pay for so don't have high expectations and all will be fine.  The location right off the I-5 is great for going north or south, and it's only 15-20 minutes from John Wayne airport.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, I would like to take this opportunity to Thank you for taking time to share your experience and thoughts from the Fairfield inn by Marriott. One of our key priorities is to provide the highest level of friendly and courteous service. While it was a pleasure having you here as our guest. If your Travels brings you back to Mission Viejo Please give us again the opportunity to serve you.  Thank you for being a Valued Customer!

Summary: Hotel:	Fairfield Inn Mission Viejo Orange County  26328 Oso Parkway Mission Viejo, California 92691 USA (949) 582-7100 The Fairfield Inn Mission Viejo Orange County was exceptionally awesome; the staffs at the front desk were very courteous, friendly and helpful. My room was situated at a quiet location as requested, room and bathroom area clean with plenty of towels. The hotel offered Free Continental Breakfast and was well maintained; the facilities which included pool and Jacuzzi areas were well maintained and clean as well. In addition guests get complimentary free parking!! Overall I rate this hotel 5 Stars!!! Dates of stay: Sep 26, 2015 - Sep 27, 2015

Summary Heading: Great customer service and good location!!!1
Summary: The main reason for me to go here over and over again is because of the great customer service. Connor, Melanie and Gisela are awesome at treating you the way you should be treated as a valued customer. The rooms are a little old but it is good for the price you pay. Morning buffet is pretty limited and not so attractive but oh well. Good right off the freeway location which makes it easier to go to places. I will definitely recommend it to the people I know just because of the customer service.

I was just there over night however the stay was nice. Room were clean, they were training staff at the front desk so I was delayed a bit but it was OK. Close to the freeway but not too much noise. A pretty good continental breakfast in the morning.
Manager Response: Der Glenn C,   Please accept my sincere apologies for the unexpected time at check inn time. We appreciate you choosing to stay at our hotel and thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about your visit. Hope you give us an opportunity to better serve you If your travels brings you back to Mission Viejo.  Best Regards,  Gisela,B

Summary Heading: Glad that we were only here for one night
Summary: We used Marriott points to stay here for one night enroute to San Diego.  It seemed like we were given one of the worst rooms on the property.  The elevator was right across from our door and created a lot of noise. Our window view showed a long patch of tar covered with dirt and concrete slabs above that.  I truly felt like I was looking out of a jail cell. The window was absolutely filthy as well. We were given exactly 2 hand towels, washcloths and bath towels.  They were thin and scratchy. When I read the other reviews I can't believe that we stayed at the same place.
Manager Response: Dear MICritic5,   Thank you for taking time to share your experience at the Fairfield inn by Marriott. One of our priorities is to provide the highest level of friendly and courteous service. While it was a pleasure having you here as our guest.  I truly apologize for the incomvenience of the room  location Unfortunaly sometimes it goes away from our hands in blocking the rooms away from any noice due to our high occupancy. I am very sorry we did not quite meet your expectations. Please assure that your comments have been shared with the team in an effort to improve our service experiences. Thank you for being a Valued Customer we hope you give us the opportunity to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Mission Viejo.

Summary: I've stayed here many times for soccer tournaments located in Orange County.  Nothing special but located off the freeway and close enough to many soccer venues.  Rooms are average.  Sometimes, you can smell the hamburgers from the nearby fast food joint. The rooms are clean, breakfast is free, parking is ample, and staff is friendly.  This place is typically lower in price than nearby hotels and is great for the budget minded soccer family.
Manager Response: Dear Jocelyn, Thank you for taking time to share your experience at the Fairfield inn by Marriott. One of our priorities is to provide the highest level of friendly and courteous service to all of our Guests and I would like to take this opportunity to thank you for your loyalty to us and at the same time please accept my sincere apologies if you were able to smell the hamburgers from the fast food near us and for the freeway noise Unfortunately when we have a full house it is impossible for us to avoid blocking rooms away from any noise. Ms. Jocelyn if your travels brings you back to Mission Viejo please contact me directly at the Hotel and I will be more than happy to assist you.  Thank You.

Summary: You know those amusements rides where, after you have completed it, they funnel you into the ride's gift shop? Well, getting to this F.I. reminded me of that, except that instead of a gift shop you have to make a sharp right ( make sure you signal) into a gas station and down a ramp to get to the property. You CAN miss it and wind up on I-5 (as I did) and have to circle around winding up on the opposite side of the street however upon approach. I laughed out loud. Hey, but when your on your way to the airport ( half way between SNA and Dana Harbor) you can fill up your rental without the proverbial search for one before returning it. Convenient. The hotel has no sundry so the gas station doubles as late night snack haven. Other than no safe in the room it was status quo all the

I chose this hotel for proximity to Mission Hospital where I was scheduled to have cancer surgery. When the staff found out the reason for my stay they went up and beyond to make sure I was comfortable and that I had everything I needed.  Kyle even surprised me by delivering me a bouquet of flowers that had been dropped off making sure I received them right away.  The compassion and kindness from the Fairfield Inn staff really helped me through this difficult time..Fairfield Inn Rocks!

Good room, convenient location, all good - but the service sets this hotel apart. Very professional and effective.   Arriving late at night and very hungry, the very busy desk clerk offered a comprehensive list of nearby restaurants, and free :-) shuttle to take me there, though it couldn't pick me up because the shuttle doesn't run after 9:30pm. The shuttle driver was courteous and efficient and he gave me the hotel card, suggesting that that a cab might come for me faster if the hotel called on my behalf.   Note: There are a lot of very good things about this hotel, as good as it gets for a hotel of this kind, but I hold that 5th star for an extraordinary hotel.

We wanted to stay close to our home and this hotel was absolutely wonderful. The GM Mr. Greg Mahone and his staff was absolutely wonderful and professional. The entire staff was very pleasant. Loved the new look and feel of the hotel. House keeping Imelda ensured that are room was cleaned and comfortable everyday. I would recommend this hotel to my clients and friends.. It's also close to everything from entertainment to the the freeways. We felt very welcome and very comfortable..

Summary Heading: The hotel is right off of the Freeway which makes it easy to go places.  Just few minutes from Irvine Spectrum.
Summary: I walked in the door and immediately relaxed and felt like home. Nice and clean lobby. The staff are friendly and professional. My room was great, very comfortable. Immaculately clean. Great shower, wonderful tub. The hotel is right off of the Freeway which makes it easy to go places.  Just few minutes from Irvine Spectrum. Walk to convenient store and fast food. Easy and free parking.

Fairfield Inn Mission Viejo is very centrally located to reach Irvine to the North or San Juan Capistrano to the South. You can locate beaches easily by going West on Crown Valley Pkwy and turning right or left on PCH. The Inn is tucked behind a gas station but worth the stay. Comfortable, nicely appointed breakfast room and two computer stations if you don't want to go to your room. Staff is excellent in providing for their guests, attentive to specific needs when necessary and making one feel special and cared for. Rooms are comfortable with great, back supporting beds, pool area is nice and parking is never a problem. This is the only place I stay in Orange County!

My family and I recently stayed at this hotel for many nights and one thing I can say forsure is that, it was one of the nicest and most comfortable hotels I have stayed in. It is close to everything including malls and shopping centers. The rooms are very elegant and can comfortably sleep 4 people per room. I will forsure be saying here again!!!

Not a bad place to stay if you are in the area.  Rooms are average size, but are clean and well maintained.  Breakfast is included, and had good options including waffles which my kids love.  The pool area is nice as well.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.

After years of driving home to San Diego after the Pageant of the Masters performance, we decided to use our points to spend the night close by.  Fairfield was on the way home, the usual efficient check-in, clean rooms and lobby, and great breakfast.  Also was nice to lounge in the pool and spa the next morning.  Can't think of any improvements to make.  Keep up the good work!

I stay here 2 or 3 times a year on business. Rooms and public areas are always clean and in good repair. Staff has always been professional and friendly, but it seems like it has "kicked up a notch" with the addition of new GM, Greg. He took time to meet my colleagues and I in the sitting area and go out of his way to ensure that we were satisfied. I can also see Greg's hospitality leadership influence on the rest of the team (several Front Desk associates and Juan in Maintenance, specifically). My only suggestion would be the possible addition of a little help in breakfast during the busiest times.

Maurer Technical Services conducts training sessions monthly at the Fairfield Inn, MV. We are extremely pleased with the hotel and services. The staff is professional, kind and always willing to accommodate our business needs. The meeting room is clean, coffee and water is always in place and the equipment is working properly. The meeting room is equipped with the latest in presentation equipment. There has been times when we needed printer paper and the staff quickly filled our needs. The manager is Greg Mahone.  He is warm and friendly and  quickly offers assistance. Imelda is friendly and anxious to please. The staff is why we have done repeat business with them for more than 9 years.
Manager Response: Thank you all the Maurer Technical Services for staying with us and choosing our ballroom to conduct your training sessions here at The Fairfield Inn in Mission Viejo it is always a great pleasure to have you guys here. I appreciate you took a moment from your valuable time to express those good comments about all of our staff, I will make sure to let everyone know about it especially to Greg Mahone and Imelda . Maurer Technical Services We hope that we can have the opportunity to welcome you back again when ever your travels brings you back to Mission Viejo  Best Regards, Gisela

Summary: Went to OC fair about 15 miles from hotel. Location good right off fwy. Staff very friendly and went out of their way for us.Breakfast was better than Most for quick easy breakfast and lots of tables for seating.

The location of this hotel is very convenient it's close to freeway but we had no problem with noise.  There are lots of restaurants nearby and convenience stores.  The hotel was full all weekend but at no time did I feel like there were lines anywhere and hotel looked clean at all times.   We asked for our room not to be serviced but the housekeeping were so nice and asked us if we would like anything extra.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your great comments!!!! I will pass these comments on to the rest of Our team! We pride ourselves on making memorable and lasting impressions on our guest because you chose to stay with us  and it is greatly appreciated.  We are thoroughly pleased you had a great time and we look forward to seeing you again in the future!!!!   Sincerely, Gisela

Summary: The staff is very helpful and have gone out of their way to honor our special requests for adjoining rooms with specific bed configurations when our out of state family comes to visit.  The free breakfast makes it so easy for us to get started on our Southern California adventures.  The General Manager, Greg and the Sales Manager, Imelda are a pleasure to deal with!

Traveling with my family I decided to stay at this hotel while driving to Disneyland and get a better hotel cost for the first night. The hotel was cleaned but the guest next to my room decided to invite a ¨night¨ lady at 3 AM. He slammed the door when entering which woke me up. Since the two rooms had the interconnecting door,  I could clearly hear the woman screaming (sexually). This was very uncomfortable specially while travelling with the family and looking for good night sleep for the long day that awaited me at Disneyland.  The woman left  approximately at 10 AM. Hotel management should pay more attention on guest introducing prostitutes.
Manager Response: Dear Moreegoo  Thank you for taking the time to share feedback on your recent visit to our hotel in Mission Viejo. I am very sorry to hear that you and your family experienced unexpected noise situation late at night  coming from the next room Guest, unfortunately we can not control Situations like this to happen with our Hotel Guests. I truly ask you and your family to please accept my apologies for the bad experience and for not been fully satisfied during your stay. Your comments have been shared with the team in an effort to improve our service experiences. Once again Thank you for being a Valued Customer we hope you give us the opportunity to serve you better whenever your travels bring you back to Mission Viejo.  Warm Regards, Gisela, B

Summary: A little difficult to see the first time when looking because it is located behind a gas station and convenience store but well worth staying here. The rooms are big, roomy and kept very clean plus everything is in working order as it should be. The mattresses and cushions are EXTREMELY comfortable. The parking lot is well lit for safety. The variety of the breakfast buffet is more than adequate with good tasting food. The room rates were VERY good for what I understand goes in this area. The Front Desk people are so friendly and helpful especially BRITNEY. She is an absolute joy to work with in friendliness, helpfulness, professionalism and competency. Colin is also exceptional. Would definitely stay here again when in this area.

Summary Heading: Great Value and even better service!!!
Summary: Our out of town guests stayed here, for our daughters wedding in San Juan Capistrano. The Rep Imelda and all the team were simply awesome. Very professional and all special needs were taken care of. The rooms are very reasonably priced for Orange County and the hotel is strategically located for easy freeway and beach access. The rooms and property are nice and clean.

Summary Heading: Good Value for Southern Orange County
Summary: This Fairfield Inn is right off the I-5 in Mission Viejo at the Oso Parkway exit. Check in and check out were smooth and professional. Staff was knowledgeable about the area. Room was clean and comfortable. Free wi-fi and large selection of breakfast items in the morning. Saw a number of children at breakfast, but the hotel was quiet at night. Staff made a habit of welcoming guest when they entered the hotel, which is a nice touch. For the area, the room rate was a good value.

Summary Heading: best hotel stay we ever had
Summary: the customer service at this hotel is amazing we treated like royalty every request was met with smiles the breakfast was amazing the staff was helpful at all hours of the day and night gisela was the best

We stayed here years ago because the location was so convenient to all of the fields.  The price was very steep for what you get.  We paid $180 for one night and that was the AAA rate.  They hotel would not allow single night stay at booking so they jacked up the price if you wanted to stay one day.  For a sports team planning to stay, here are some tips.  Small pool that was crowded with two other teams during our stay.  Breakfast room was used for our team party but, they do not allow adult beverages of any kind in the public areas! The rooms were small and we felt very crowded even with 2 people in the room.  Breakfast was very good and with many selections.  Hotel is clean and staff is nice.  I would consider other hotels next year as this place has changed since our last

This hotel was very nice for the price.  Close to where we were going, which was a friend's holiday party.  It's a little hard to find at first, as it is behind a gas station, but once you find your way there, it was just as you would expect from any Marriott property.

Stayed here during a business trip and loved the convenient location. The hotel exterior is a little dated, but I can tell that they tried to 'modernize' the rooms/lobby inside. The lobby area is large and spacious and they offer a very basic (kind of disappointing breakfast buffet). Service was terrific. The room was clean and comfy, but the carpet seemed dingy and dated. Also, if you're traveling with someone/sharing a room - THE BATHROOMS DO NOT HAVE A FART FAN, ha.
Manager Response: Please allow me this opportunity to thank you for your thoughts and comments about our breakfast buffet and about our bathroom fans, Unfortunately at this location we dont have a regular fan but we do have an exhaust fan on each of our bathrooms.  Fairfield inn is committed to provide our guest with the highest quality service and facilities. we sincerely regret we fell short of our goal  during your recent stay. Upholding our committed to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us when ever your travels brings you back to Mission Viejo.  Sincerely, Front Desk Manager Gisela B

Summary: We had a great time here.  The staff was very friendly and professional.  The breakfast had a lot of variety and good quality.  Clean room.  We did not use the pool but it looked nice and clean.  Nice area.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay on business for a few days
