Summary: I have stayed at this location several times over the past 3 years while traveling on business trips. I generally stay 3 nights (Mon-Wed night). The hotel is clean does not smell or look worn. The rooms are what you would expect for a hotel in California that costs less than $200 a night. The hotel is near a highway and depending on where your room is the highway noise may bother you. I've found a sound machine or leaving the fan on from the ac/heater takes care of the noise. The breakfast is very simple - but adequate for those without dietary restrictions. They are one of a few hotels which do NOT charge for parking.

We were supposed to stay here 1 night on the way to Los Angeles and it was terrible! We checked in early, got our room on the top floor, and were greeted by chemicals in our room. I started coughing and we couldn't breathe! We went down to the front desk and told them our situation and they felt real bad and called the courtyard nearby to get us a room on the highest floor possible, which we got the top. I will never stay here ever again and this hotel should totally be tore down and rebuilt! The best part of this hotel was the staff and leaving. Please do yourself a favor and do not stay here! I hate complaining but trust me, it was really bad but I loved the staff!
Manager Response: Dear Brandon,  Thank you for your review. I am deeply sorry for the problem you encountered with the our room odour. This is not the type of room you should expect from a Fairfield Inn. Making your stay a complete success is our goal. Just let our Manager On Duty or front desk staff know if any part of your stay isn’t satisfactory. We promise to make it right or you won’t pay for that part of your stay."  Sincerely,  Ashish Ray Fairfield Inn, Marriott Mission Viejo

Summary: My stay was awesome. I visited Mission Viejo for business and had to say thanks to the staff it felt just like a vacation. At check in, Britney was spectacular. Smooth check in, super fast and friendly. Kylee and Collin were also attentive. Manager Gisela was courteous and available at all times. Idalia and other lady in cafeteria/breakfast were great and worked very hard to maintain the area clean (people could be so dirty). Facility was also very clean and Maintenance Man assisted me with a rope I needed at last minute.  I am very observant when I visit Hotels, Restaurants or any business in general since customer service is something that should come naturally, just like all the above-mentioned!   I will definitely consider staying here again but next time It will be with my

This was a very comfy, roomy & clean hotel. Had everything we needed, pool, workout room, complimentary breakfast ( great variety). The staff were very friendly & eager to please. Our family had several rooms & everyone was very pleased.

The staff was nice but check in and out was painfully slow.  Our room was dark with limited lighting. The bed was comfortable enough, and had two feather and two non-feather pillows. There were no power outlets at the nightstands, unfortunately. Hotels really need to get modern and have power hubs on each nightstand.  The shower/tub combo had some mold, unfortunately. The water pressure was low, but the hot water stayed hot.  The free WiFi was strong. The free parking lot is large and open-air. For the ridiculously slow check in & check out alone I might consider looking to stay elsewhere the next time I'm in town.
Manager Response: Dear Road Wrangler  Please allow me this opportunity to apologize for all the inconveniences you experienced during your stay here at the Fairfield Inn  Marriott You willingness to share your thoughts is appreciated. Fairfield Inn is committed to providing our guests with the highest quality services and facilities. We sincerely regret we fell short of our goal in this instance. Your comments are important to the success of our Hotel, as we rely on you, our guest, to tell us how we are doing and how we can better meet your needs. Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service,We hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Mission Viejo.  Sincerely, Gisela Barrera

Summary Heading: A bit disappointed, compared to other Fairfield's.
Summary: We've stayed at Fairfield Inn's before, and I don't know if it was just Platinum Upgrades the got us the extra perks before, or if there really were these kinds of differences, but this wasn't the best stay.  The rooms didn't have microwaves or fridges (which the last one did) the breakfast was a little sad, the beds were super firm and "bouncy" when rolling over at night, the room had a smell of moisture or mildew which was very apparent when entering from the hall, and the water from the sink tasted awful. I didn't even want to use it to wash my face or brush my teeth.  Also, one of the elevators was broken, and one of the girls who was waiting with us for the other said it was broken last summer she was here as well.  Wasn't the worst stay in the world, still better than some
Manager Response: Dear Kayla S  Please allow me this opportunity to apologize for all the inconveniences you experienced during your stay here at the Fairfield Inn  Marriott You willingness to share your thoughts is appreciated. Fairfield Inn is committed to providing our guests with the highest quality services and facilities. We sincerely regret we fell short of our goal in this instance. Your comments are important to the success of our Hotel, as we rely on you, our guest, to tell us how we are doing and how we can better meet your needs. Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service,We hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Mission Viejo.  Sincerely, Front Desk Supervisor Gisela Barrera gisela.barrera@marriott.com

Summary Heading: Home Away from Home in Southern California
Summary: I stayed here in mid/late February while attending a friend's wedding.  Thanks to other reviews, I knew the turn into the hotel would be quick and unexpected.  The road sign says Fairfield Inn but it does not look like an intersection and you literally have to drive between the two gas stations and don't see the hotel until the road begins to dip down.  It is very conveniently located off of the 5.  Just be sure to pay attention as northbound is a right out of the hotel and southbound is left from the hotel where you came in from.  The location was super convenient to events we had taking place in nearby Ladera Ranch and San Clemente.  The room was not huge and the angled door to the bathroom a bit awkward but not a problem as I was traveling alone.  I was right by the elevator

We stayed here two nights while visiting family in the area.  The hotel is very clean and nicely decorated. The front desk people couldn't have been nicer or more helpful.  The rates were very good, especially having a AAA discount.  It also has a decent breakfast.  Since I eat gluten-free, it was nice that there were eggs, sausage or bacon and fruit instead of just having cereal and pastries.  The food was replenished as soon as it ran out and the breakfast area is roomy.    The rooms are clean and nicely decorated, but our room was small; we had requested a king and there is not much room when the bathroom door is open, but we were basically there to sleep, so it was ok.  The bed and pillows were very comfortable.  There was a coffee maker and hair dryer, pretty standard

We got to the hotel at 11pm. It would be nice if the hotel sign is more prominent from the road. As you drive pass you only see the two gas stations because Fairfield Inn is tacked away behind and between the 2 gas stations.  This hotel is comfortable, clean and quiet. Breakfast is adequate The coffee maker in the room is greatly appreciated. Thank you for using only paper plates.

the staff went out of its way to give us what we wanted. it was done quickly every time. we felt special every time we stayed there. we return at least once a month and wouldnt stay anywhere else.  they also have the best breakfast buffet we have ever seen

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for a great Price
Summary: Visiting my grandma who lives off of OSO Pwky. Needed something close and I didn't want to sacrifice quality. It's not the cheapest hotel but its location and quality were perfect. The beds were comfortable, the breakfast hot and the showers warm. I will most definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: All That You Could Ask For In An Inexpensive Hotel
Summary: I have stayed at this property multiple times during the past couple of years. The staff are friendly and efficient; the beds are comfortable, with excellent mattresses, the climate control is fine, and there is more than adequate space for working or relaxing...This hotel is an excellent value in an expensive area. Highly recommended!

Summary Heading: Visit to Mission San Juan Capistrano
Summary: We stayed Dec 29 at the Fairfield Inn San Juan Capistrano and we loved it.   My daughter had a mission report and it was conveniently located, 2 exits from the hotel. The only thing about the hotel is that the entrance to it comes up fast off the exit. It's located behind the gas station and if you blink you'll miss it. I used Waze on my phone and it was pretty accurate but didn't prepare me for the immediate turn to the entrance.   The lobby was modern, spacious, clean layout, plenty of outlets for electronic devices.   We had room in the back because I thought there would be road noise.   The beds were great, pillow topped and thick comforters.   The gym was small but did the job. It had a treadmill, recumbent bike and dumb bells.   Breakfast was good too. Eggs, Belgian

Nice hotel with newly remodeled rooms and lobby but the noise from the Freemay was just too much. If you do stay here asked for rooms on the other side away from the freeway. Staff is friendly and helpfulbreakfast is your typicalfree type. We're staying here in the center of action but bring your plugs

I think this hotel is meant to meet your needs, not necessarily go above and beyond. It is located right off of the freeway so you need to be careful what room you get if quietness is desired. The first room they assigned us was right on the freeway which of course was quite noisy. We requested another room and were given a much quieter location. Rooms are adequate.

My husband and I stayed here for only one night for an event. We basically used the hotel to get ready for a party and to sleep. It's what you would expect of any Fairfield Inn. Clean, efficient, and a very courteous staff. Breakfast was included but we didn't wake up early enough to try it.  We asked for a late checkout and they were nice enough to give it to us without a hassle. Overall, I would stay here again if I needed a place to stay for an event or business.

Summary Heading: Just what it says on the tin with a few gripes
Summary: used my points to stay for a week on business and it was fine  A budget place I had four gripes though   1. no safe in the room 2. See point one when I came back the cleaning lady hadn't shut door properly so from when I left the room and the room was clean the room with no safe had my passport , Mac book and 2000 dollars available for anyone to walk in and take  3. Door handle only opened upwards unlike all the other rooms which was a challenge when checking in at 1 am after a 42 HR trip  4 each day long black hairs in bath and being bald and blonde it was a bit of a surprise

The only reason I gave this hotel 4 stars instead of 5 is because the room does not have a refrigerator or microwave. Otherwise this is a great hotel. Check in was super fast, staff was courteous and friendly, checked in late and had no problems. We had a king room next to the elevator. Room was very clean and large enough with a king bed and sofa, very comfortable and quiet, could not hear the elevator. Convenient to the I-5 freeway and next to two convenience stores. Breakfast was good and the eating area very comfortable. It would also be nice if coffee and hot water were available more than just morning hours. All in all a comfortable stay.

My daughter had cheer camp in San Juan Capistrano and this is the place the staff chose for all the girls to stay.  It was supposed to be the cheapest in the area.  It wasn't really cheap and I don't get why it was so expensive. I think you pay cheaper in Vegas and Vegas actually has things to do.  Mission Viejo is pretty boring so the rooms should be cheaper.  Anyhoot, the hotel was nice, the staff was super nice and the rooms were ok.  A bit small but nice and clean.  Except for the bathroom sink, it had a bad odor coming out like sewer water.  We literally had the pool to ourselves the first day so that was awesome. My little one enjoyed the whole pool for hours.  Breakfast was pretty good too.  It was a nice experience and would stay there again if I HAVE to go back to that

Fairfield Marriott Inns are a favorite of mine and this one is no exception. The checkout time of 12:00pm is one of the reasons for this love as I am not a morning person. Speaking of morning, their breakfast is pretty good. Sausage or bacon. Cereal, yogurt, waffles and toast. All you can eat. Make a plate and take it back to your room or eat in the comfortable dining area and watch TV. The kids loved it.   The rooms have the single unit air conditioners that lull me to sleep and make the room feel like a meat locker or a sauna depending on your temperature preference. The maids were excellent despite my children's best efforts to trash the place.   The pool was decent and a great place to take a dip after the salt water and sand of the ocean and beach.   It's right off the

After driving for 12 hours through flash floods in AZ we tried to check in with reservations. They couldn't find them. Finally got much smaller bed (double) than we reserved (Queen).  Room soooo small you had to go outside to change your mind.  NO Refrigerator, NO microwave, Only 1 set of towels.  TV remote didn't work.  Room cleaning left much to be desired.  Interesting that even in a record drought there was not one, NOT One in room notice to try to conserve (except a very old sign to reuse your towel (singular) which we had to do anyway.  We had to use our emergency roll of TP due to a shortage in the room with no replacement.  Comp Breakfast was an equal disappointment. Being a diabetic there was no accomodation for us. No low carb cereal, no low carb syrup, no low carb
Manager Response: Dear Bob L, Thank you for choosing the Fairfield Inn, Mission Viejo, CA!  We appreciate all your comments. We do apologize that your experience was not to your satisfaction, however, we will make sure that we address all of your concerns and make improvements in respective  areas. We do not have queen bed at our property, We only have doubles only. Our rooms are small in comparison but they are still comfortable size. We do have refrigerator and microwave available but upon request, We do follow Marriott guide line  up on your request to not to change linens for 3 days to conserve water. we have 2 signs one in room and one in bathroom to conserve water.  We do have extra towels and all necessary items available at front desk or upon request bring it to your room.  Comp breakfast we offer sausage but every other day, we do have oatmeal, light yogurt , fresh fruits and multigrain bread as healthy option for breakfast.   Our goal is that every guest leave our hotel with a positive experience and we hope that you choose our hotel gain on your next trip.

Summary: Pros: Clean, comfortable, updated, free parking, several breakfast options, friendly staff, great location, good toiletries, reliable wi-fi, 24- hr Carl's Jr.  Cons: Lumpy pillows (I think they were sheets stuffed with face cloths), too much light coming in the window (DH told me to write that), no fridge (very inconvenient) and minor freeway noise. It didn't bother us in the room we had but it is there if you are sensitive.

Stayed in July.  The hotel is in the middle of some pretty serious road construction on Oso Pkwy, but is convenient to I-5 North.  It is an extremely clean hotel -- one of the cleanest I have been in.  The accomodations are basic -- this is not a fancy hotel -- but they were quite sufficient especially for the price.  The first night, power went out, presumably from the road construction as other businesses outside the hotel were also without power.  Luckily the window in the room opened just a bit, providing fresh air.  We were provided with glow sticks for the night.  The power came on early the next morning, JUST in time for a shower and preparation for work.

at the outset $129 was little expensive, but the best rates offered for a 10 day stay was very professional..the staff are very helpful that you will get the things you want from them in a jiffy.. clean place with quality breakfast...

A fine hotel, and for about $100, you get the usual big-chain generic hotel, but it's clean and has all you want. Zero creep-out factor, safe room, a good night's sleep. The front desk staff tried sticking me with a poorly-located room (noisy) but did trade it out (for a quieter room, even if it was one with a 3/4 size floor plan.) They were also utterly clueless that they could fix the luggage cart by going to the gas station next door and inflating the tires, but their heart was in the right place.

Stayed here on business trip for two weeks,  Its basic hotel, but thats not to say it was not up to scratch, Rooms kept very tidy and clean. Staff very helpful, Pool and Hot Tub fine. Minor issues, breakfast on paper plates, Gym TV not working

Summary Heading: Not easy to find, but worth the effort.
Summary: The hotel is behind two gas stations/convenience stores, and even though the light you turn at has a green sign that says "Fairfield Inn" it is still easy to miss.  It is right off of the freeway making it convenient to everything.  Although the property is older they have kept it fresh, but by no means it is fancy. Just a good basic place to stay at a reasonable price.  There isn't even a closet...just a tiny little armoire.  No sofa, just a chair and the TV mostly just basic cable.  The A/C is the old under the window, noisy crank on and off kind.  Breakfast can be hectic when the hotel is full, but I have to say they had some of the best donuts at a hotel buffet I have ever had and there was a fresh fruit salad that was very good as well.

Stayed there on a business trip, Staff very professional and made it a point to Greet and Welcome every guest or greet you accordingly. Entire hotel and rooms are very clean and comfortable. Everything was in working condition. The only thing one has to ask for Micro/fridge unit if needed. Not included in the rooms. Breakfast was the usual, the attendant was  friendly and was attentive to refilling the items as needed! This particular stay the breakfast room was quite busy. Found out the hotel was almost entirely booked due to a wedding and other function/events. The cute part is as one enters the parking lot towards the back you see a bunch of Bunny Rabbits hip hopping around the landscape. Hotel is off the I-5 fwy........but quiet. It sits above a slight hill above the

I stayed here on a recent business trip and picked this hotel because it was the lowest price Marriott branded property in the area.  The hotel is located right off the 5 freeway and sits behind two convenience stores which made it a wee bit hard to find.  When I checked in, the hotel was almost full so I was given an accessible room.  Accessible in this case meant that the bathroom was larger with a lot of grab handles.  The bed (a king) was comfortable and had actual king size pillows.  There was no closet to hang your clothes but there was a rather tiny armoire instead.  There was a work desk but it was right in front of the A/C unit (drafty!) and had only one outlet (phone or computer, not both).  That A/C unit had a rather noisy compressor when it cycled on.  The TV got

I was able to book this hotel well in advance and boy am I  the rate that I got.  The hotel is very well run.  The front desk staff goes out of their way to be helpful.  The pool is gorgeous.  Hot tub, hot. Free breakfast seven days a week.  Very clean property.  I had some difficulty locating the entrance to the property.  The driveway is situated between 2 gas stations directly off the 405/5.    I will be staying here again.

Booked 20 rooms when my wife and I were getting married for all the family to use. Got a great group rate for everybody. Rooms are clean, beds are comfortable. Nothing very fancy about this hotel but really no need. Staff are really nice, its clean, the food is good, and that's all we were looking for at the time.

We stayed for 6 nights. The Hotel sits right next to the 5 Fwy, (noisy) on our third night I asked to move to another room because of the freeway noise, they moved us to the 5th floor right next to the Ice Machine, I guess that’s what you get for complaining. There was a really bad odor on the 5th floor, I told the front desk and they said that they were aware of it and that the cleaning lady couldn't do her work as well. About 30 minutes later I went back up to my room and the entire hallway smelled like air freshener??? I suggest you ask for a room on the other side away from the freeway, elevators and ice machine. The Staff are too friendly you can tell it’s their policy and they have to be nice (it's to fake) the rooms are basic; the beds are ok nothing special. The air
Manager Response: We do apologize for a poor experience during your recent stay. Your feedback is very important to us and we will be taking measures to ensure that the avoidable issues you experienced are addressed. In regard to our staff’s mannerisms, it is our policy to hire those who are passionate about customer service and respond in a professional way to all requests or problems a guest may have. We thank you for your business and will use the information you provided to improve everyone’s experience. We welcome you stay with us again in the future

Summary: Had an event at country club up the street so location was great. When we checked it we were given a first floor room next to the freeway.  Way too noisy... But they were nice about making a change. Tons of soccer kids at breakfast ... No place to sit!

Not a bad hotel if you're stopping off in the area for a night or two. Great proximity to 5 freeway, convenience stores, and a quick bite to eat. Because I had to leave so early, I didn't get a chance to try the buffet.   Staff was nice and responded quickly to my requests.   Only complaint was that our bed was a little less comfortable than I expect from a Marriott brand.
Manager Response: Dear User 9999,  Thank you for choosing Fairfield Inn, Marriott for your recent stay in Mission Viejo, CA. It was a pleasure to have you as our guest. We do try our best to make sure that our guest arrive to a nice clean and comfortable environment. Unfortunately our beds do not meet to your expectation.  Our beds are approved by Fairfield Inn. We apologize that we could not meet your expectation.  We hope to see you again soon. Thank you for your feed back.

Summary: I always stay at this hotel when I work in this area.It is very clean quiet for a great nights sleep with comfortable beds. But the best is the front desk I stayed there 12 nights and every night when I returned they acted like they were so happy to see me.They are great with directions etc.It is in a great location next to shops of Mission Viejo and many great restaurants right off highway 5.It is 20 minutes  from John Wayne airport. They do have a complimentary breakfast but nothing special. It is close to Laguna Beach and San Juan Capistrano.

I've stayed here 4 or 5 times when visiting friends in San Juan Capistrano.  It's always clean, well-kept, quiet, accommodating staff, and I always get a good night's sleep.  It appears they've recently renovated the place with new carpet and new furniture in the common areas.  The rooms are a bit smaller than what you'd get with an average Holiday Inn Express, the beds are doubles (not queen), there's no fridge or microwave, and it's a bit close to the freeway.  I don't hear much freeway noise because the fan on the heat/air conditioning tends to drown it out with white noise.  The bed size didn't bother me because I was travelling alone and they're certainly big enough for one person.  I'll stay here again during my next visit to the area.

This is our 2nd stay at the Fairfield Inn.  We visit our son who lives in Laguna Niguel and found the property had renovated since we came last.  Rooms were clean and new!  Pleasant front desk staff.  Great breakfast with alot of options!   Easy freeway access to all surrounding areas. We chose a room on the bottom floor near the front of hotel and no problems with noise.   We will definitely stay again!

My one night was great.  Easy check in and the room was updated and clean.  The bed was comfortable and all the amenities in the room were in working order.  The room was on the small side, but I was by myself, so that did not cause any issues.  I am sure they have larger rooms is more guests are needed per room.  I went down to the lobby for breakfast at 9:30.  I noticed the sign that said breakfast was from 6 - 9.  They were cleaning up, but there was still some items left out and they was no issue with me grabbing a couple of items and taking them to my room.

We just finished a very pleasant weekend stay at this hotel.  All staff members were customer focused and very friendly.  The front desk staff greeted us and always offered assistance as needed.  The staff member taking care of the breakfast area always had a smile and friendly word.  Breakfast in this location is included in the room rate and it was a cut above other similar hotels, including waffles and different hot entrees each morning.    The room was quite comfortable with new bedding, a usable work area and flat screen TV.  While not large, it's laid out very well.  The location is right off the 5, but we didn't hear any traffic noise at all.   Overall, a great and convenient place to stay.

the surrounding city is beautiful. i only wish the hotel had a view of lake mission viejo. the other fairfield inn is in a better location and has a better view. the only downside is that there is alot of freeway noise. an upside is that this marriot accepts points to redeem for your stay, whereas the other fairfield inn does not.

The staff at front desk really go the extra mile.  They are warm and friendly and really try to accomodate their guests.    Hotel is very clean and rooms have nice furniture.  Rooms on west side of building do have freeway noise.  The hotel is tricky to find.  It is also in a great location for South Orange County.    The breakfast was terrific and staff was really nice.  It was busy but they kept bringing out more food.  It was a friendly atmosphere.  There is plenty of parking.  I would return to t his hotel again.

July 19, 2013 One night stay on business..........As you walk in you are greeted by a professional staff. Hotel has very nice colors and décor. Rooms are very clean and crisp with everything in working condition, fresh smelling too! I booked this by chance, other hotels that I normally stay were totally booked. Better then expected especially by "Marriot" Breakfast has a variety of foods and quite tasty if you are on the run. Pool/spa area looked nice. Plenty of parking around the entire building and well lit. The cute part about the parking lot is you see a lot of cute bunny rabbits hopping in and out of the plants and landscaping. Kids would love too see that! I tried to stay there twice again but totally booked. Overall I would recommend hotel too anyone in that area!

Love the Marriott--didn't like this one.  Have stayed in the Fairfield Inns before but this was not a suite.  Freeway noise kept me up, very small room, and the towels were so small and scratchy.  So glad I was staying on a Marriott certificate because I wouldn't have wanted to pay money for this stay!

Stayed for three nights this past week.  Very clean room and building exterior. Ample lighting in the parking lot. Breakfast was good with scrambled eggs, breakfast meat, cereal, juice, coffee,and more. Slept well each iChat which is unusual for me as I have a hard time sleeping in a strange bed.  Would recommend the place to anyone staying in the area.  Close to I-5.  Starbucks is just next door and plenty to eat within a five mile radius.

Nothing special about this place, rooms were clean and I did sleep well.  Breakfast wasn't completely out at the advertised 6 AM start on Monday morning, they did have a waffle maker and scrambled eggs as hot food.  Juice machine was marked as "out of order."  I'm not sure why they would choose to have the rather politically charged Fox "News" on the television in the breakfast room, a neutral outlet would be more appropriate.  Beware of the 2 gas stations that border the driveway, the gas station customers seem oblivious to the fact that they are in the hotel driveway.  Next time I'll look for somewhere else to stay.

Summary Heading: An oasis yards from the freeway
Summary: One would expect the location to be noisy but that was not so the reception area was welcoming as was the staff they were helpful and interested in seeing we had want we needed. Nice touch the call to the room to see if all was well. The room smelled fresh and clean and the bed was a delight sheets felt new and crisp. Breakfast room is roomy you don't have to suffer the TV news it was kept clean and all kept well stocked.

Summary Heading: Responsive Attentive Staff, Nice but Simple Room
Summary: When I checked in, everyone was friendly and professional, and it was obvious my special requests had been taken into consideration. I booked on the Fairfield Website and asked for a quiet room, away from common areas, on an upper floor. The gentleman explained that he had put me in a room behind the elevator on the third floor, and to let him know if it suits my needs. The room was very quiet, I never heard other guests while in my room, and it was a busy week (fourth of July).  The room was a good size, and had been recently upgraded. The bed was comfortable, the linens were nice, and I will stay in this hotel again when traveling to Orange County.

Summary Heading: Hard to find, not worth the bother
Summary: Really hard to find, completely hidden behind 2 gas stations. Look for the green street sign "Fairfield Inn" and pull behind all the gas stations.   Really unpleasant staff, everything seems to be too much of a bother for them. "No" seems to be their favorite word.   Hotel is clean, double bed is barely a full size. Breakfast is 6:00-9:00am, so if you are on holiday or want to sleep in, not available for you.  Only stay here is Mission Veijo is your destination.

I have been staying here for the last three years because it is convenient for work.  The entry has been completely redone.  The room I stayed in was remodeled as well.  Breakfast area has expanded almost twice the size.  Was able to conduct a business meeting (three people) with no issues. Employees are friendly and helpful.  I'll stay here again.

The usual Fairfield but the free shuttle to shops and restaurants make it worth the stay. Shuttle stops running at 9:30pm.  Staff is uniformly friendly and helpful and owner/manager is on site and willing to be of assistance.  Pool area is clean and well maintained as is breakfast area.

Located just off the freeway, the hotel is convenient to get to any destinations you have in mind. The rooms are clean and supplied with a coffeemaker.  The beds are comfortable and we had the use of a fridge and microwave for the duration of our stay.  Breakfast was a continential with cereal, eggs, toast, waffles, juice, Jimmy Dean Sausage breakfast. It is free for all quests. There is a shuttle that can be used upon request to take you within 5 miles to businesses in the area. The staff was friendly, courteous and very helpful. This is a great place to unwind and relax after a busy day.

Right off the highway &  easy to get to. Close to fast food, gas stations & entrance back to highway- off course. Very clean rooms & hotel in general. friendly, helpful staff. I would stay there again. Pricing is what's to be expected in the area.

We returned to Fairfield Inn because of a positive experience last year and because it was in a convenient location with plenty of free parking. We were aware that there would be no refrigerator in our room, so I went out to get ice and found that the ice machine on our floor was broken.  I encountered another guest who was looking for ice, so we took the lift to the ice machine on the third floor. In the lift, we met a janitor bringing a refrigerator to another room.  The wi-fi in our room worked very well, there was a complete set of toiletries, and we had no problem with traffic noise.  We had a room with a king sized bed with famous Marriott pillows.  There were good channels on the TV.  We did have to hunt around for electrical outlets, and we wound up using the one on the

I was concerned that this would be a noisy place to sleep as it's ingeniously built in the armpit of the off-ramp by a major freeway. However, once on the property it felt like we were in a secluded California park! At dusk, we were greeted by a family of bunnies on the west lawn. It told me if they trusted their brood there - we could too!  Inside our room was quiet and clean. Just what weary travelers want. Our 1st morning breakfast I was perturbed to see all the oatmeal was gone and most other food was wiped out. (Not to fault the hotel since there were several cheerleading teams getting energized that morning.) It was nearly time for the breakfast to be cleared away - yet staff brought out fresh supplies of everything needed to keep everyone happy!   The staff was quick,

The hotel is fresh and very welcoming.  I received outstanding service from the front desk staff as well as the maintenance gentleman who delivered a micro fridge.   The rooms are clean, new, modern, and very comfortable.  The wifi works well, HDTV, convenient parking and right off I-5 and only 15 minutes from John Wayne airport.   This is a great choice in the OC.

I stayed at the Fairfield on the recommendation of my manager.  The rates are very reasonable and the rooms are clean and attractive.  The walls could be better insulated for sound but I have stayed at places where the walls were much thinner.  The Fairfield is located right on Oso Parkway and is easy to locate with a sign over the road.  Very convenient to Mission Hospital where I have been working...ten minute drive.  A continental breakfast includes hard boiled eggs, fruit, a variety of baked goods, a waffle iron to make waffles and a dining room attendant who is very friendly and keeps the area clean and well stocked.  Great for a business traveller.  This inn is very clean, very accommodating and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a place to stay in the Mission

We booked this hotel because: 1) It was a Marriott, 2) I could get Marriott points and 3) It was only a few miles from the State Cup soccer tournament my son was playing in. I think we got a little spoiled staying at the Ayres Hotel the past few times we've stayed at a hotel, but the rooms at the Fairfield are small. There was basically just enough room for the two double beds, a dresser w/TV & tiny closet, a desk w/chair and a upholstered chair. I requested a baby crib (pack & play) and a refrigerator w/ microwave attached on top. Those items barely fit in the corner after we rearranged some furniture. A nice perk is that the fridge & microwave were provided at no additional charge; you just have to request it. The breakfast included was okay...oatmeal, Jimmy Dean breakfast

Summary Heading: Nice rooms, great service, nice bedding and located near the freeway.
Summary: I won't bore you with details on the room.  It was a typical very nice Fairfield inn with large bedding, large big screen TV and large bulky furniture.  It was clean nd what I expected.  The only draw back is the hotel is close to the freeway.  I could hear road noise inside the room, luckily I had flown in from Atlanta and it did not disturb my sleep.  It may however disturb another guest.  If you are a light sleeper you may want to ask for a room farther away or choose another.

We had to attend a funeral and this was our suggested place to stay.  We found it to be very very clean, very nice staff, very comfortable beds, and a roomy room, a very good location for our needs and reasonable.  We only found the entrance to it a little confusing at first since it is located between two building (gas stations)  The staff were extremely helpful in getting us around and providing us with an information sheet of all eating locations making sure not to lean on one place or the other very unbias so it was our choice.  The breakfast bar was adequate - with cereal, muffins, donuts, bananas, waffles, hard boil eggs and yogurts plus coffee, tea ,oj, and milk.  I can't stress enough the cleanliness of the place and the staff being so nice.

Since the last time I was here last year this hotel has been completed renovated. They even gutted the lobby and made a new breakfast room and business office. Same breakfast as other Marriott's but boiled eggs instead of scrambled. The fron desk is the best everyone is friendly and knowledable with directions. I stayed there 14 days and they made me feel like family. It is very clean and the house keepers are the best. But they are kind of stingy with the coffee but the coffee in the lobby and room are delicious.

Newly redone--great staff--rooms and breakfast area are perfect in my opinion..Staff very helpful when needed..When you enter you have a very comfortable, welcome feeling..You immediately know it has been recently updated and kept clean..

Stayed one night on 5th floor, even though this property is ringed by the northbound on-ramp to The 5, we didn't hear any highway noise.  Free WiFi worked great, and front desk was friendly and provided a complimentary forgotten toiletry item.   It's been recently remodeled, our room was fresh and clean.  The only issue was the bathroom fan droned constantly--I don't think there was a way to turn it "off".  Breakfast was nice, plenty of choices and places to sit.  The driveway to the hotel is a bit odd, you drive between two gas stations but it's clearly marked as "Fairfield Drive".

Good value, good location, free breakfast and free parking.  Reasonably sized rooms and quieter than we expected despite the place being so close to I-5.  Internet access was adequate with two terminals in the lobby as well as free access in the room.

Summary Heading: Clean, quiet, great location and value
Summary: I stayed there for two nights while on business last week and would stay there again anytime.  It was clean and quiet and the staff were friendly and professional.  Add a good location, right by the interstate with food and quickie marts in walking distance, and a reasonable price, and I am very satisfied with my stay!

We stayed one night at Fairfield Inn in Mission Viejo. They were remodeling, so it was pretty loud during working hours. Most of the people that we saw walking through the lobby were wearing hard hats. We were in room 506 with a view of the highway ramp (but no highway noise unless the window was open). They had a room for us when we checked in at 11 a.m.  Plus •	Large screen TV, good channels •	Wi-fi was reliable, although we had to accept the terms of service and enter the password every time we went on line •	Breakfast was pretty good with hard boiled eggs, cereal, Danish, waffle-maker. They had to use three guest rooms for breakfast because the breakfast area was being renovated •	We had a room with a king-sized bed with small but sufficient space •	The staff were especially

I recently attended the Doheney Days Music Festival on Sept 08th and wanted nice accommodations with a pool at a rate of around $90-$100. Since I procrastinated and waited until a week before this large event to book many of the lodgings close to Dana Point (where the event was held) were sold out or way over my budget. Since I travel to San Diego often I had seen this place many times and thought I would give them a try, it was a simple 10-15min cab ride from where I was going so the location was good. I arrived at noon on the 8th check in was not till 3:00 the folks at the front desk were very nice and explained that they could put me in a room but since it was early they did not have a clean room that met my room request (high upper floor room over looking the pool area) I

The front desk personnel at this beautifully rennovated Fairfield Inn were so uninterested in working that they bordered on being rude.  The first comment when we checked in took place after we gave our name.  The woman then said "photo id and credit card."  She never said another word - no welcome, no anything.  We then asked if we were getting our "points" for the stay, she said "yes."  She did say we were on the third floor and the rooms had been redecorated.  That attitude continued the next morning with a different clerk.  When we handed in the keys and said we were checking out of room-number.  She took the keys and said "okay."  I must say that in the over 25 years we have stayed at Marriott properties this was the first time we got "bland" treatment.  That staff needs to

We visited friends in San Juan Capistrano and we wanted to find a hotel that was close but not too expensive. (Hotels in San Juan Capistrano are few and over priced!) Fairfield Inn is only 10 minutes away and easy access to I-5!  Great customer service from front desk, continental breakfast server.  I also noticed they always had someone cleaning the grounds around the hotel!   We were on the 5th floor in a renovated room.  Room was spotless; beds were comfortable.   Pleasantly surprised with continental breakfast options!  Offered more than expected!  Very much worth the price paid for the hotel room.  Hotel is also close to quite a few golf courses--within 10 minutes of hotel!

We came in at midnight with tired kids so we appreciated that the front desk person was very accommodating and efficient. The room rate was more than fair and the room itself was very clean, very comfortable and the breakfast was perfect for our family. Would recommend this hotel as a perfect stop-over during a long trip!

Front desk staff were so helpful and welcoming here! Room was fine and fairly quiet even though it faced freeway and gas station. Pool area was nice, just lacked towels (but there were a ton of people there and towels were likely a hot commodity).  Room very clean. Breakfast was pretty good too. As we were there with a large contingent of lacrosse boys, everyone was very tolerant and helpful...even made sure we could grab something for breakfast VERY early!

My family and I stayed at this Fairfield for a softball tournament in May. It is located behind a gas station and Carl's Jr, so you cannot see it from Oso Parkway. The location is near Interstate 5, but I did not hear any freeway noise in my room. The rooms were smaller than I expected, but we managed. The upper floors have been recently refurbished, so I would ask for one of those rooms. The pool is heated and open until 10:00pm. The staff was friendly and accommodating. Not a bad place to stay if you are passing through.

Summary Heading: Impeccable service, as usual for Marriott
Summary: We just needed a single night stop over on our way through.  The price and location were right.  The value was excellent.  It's not a stunning setting, but very functional and well run.  I can always count on Marriott properties to execute flawlessly.  That's a major comfort when booking something that I haven't been to before.

I stayed here for 2 days, 3 nights and was pleasantly surprised.  The room was small and had no fridge, but it was clean and modern. The hotel property is nice, and the staff were very friendly.  The location also served us nicely as we were visiting friends in San Juan Capistrano. Traffic conditions on the I-5 may vary, but we were able to drive to Los Angeles and Anaheim within 45 and 25 minutes respectively.  I enjoyed the continental breakfast, but if you don't like waffles, sweet pastries/doughnuts, and cereal for breakfast, then you will be disappointed.  There are two gas stations/convenience stores located directly adjacent to the hotel.  I didn't use the pool, but it appeared clean and well-maintained.  I'm not a light sleeper, but if you are, you may find it difficult

Summary Heading: Ok for a one night stay
Summary: Stayed here because my son's soccer team had a game in the area.  Location is great, right off the I-5 freeway but hard to find tucked behind a Carls Jr. and 76 gas station.This must have been another hotel before it became a Marriott.  The layout in the font area was small, the business center & gym are in the same room, and the buffet area doubled as the lounge area.  With all that Marriott delivers, they tried to do in a building that just wasn't an original Marriott.  The staff is great, no problem checking in or out. The room were adequate, but dark.  They had alot of lamps in the room, even a little table size lamp on the armoire (no closests) that seemed out of place. The beds were hard, and the towels quite worn. Luckily they are under construction and is getting a much

Summary Heading: Great location.  Hard as rock beds. Still under construction.
Summary: First the staff are wonderful.  The breakfast was okay and the seating area colorful.  The poor staff do what they can to make it nice.  Who ever thought bumpy tile was good to use in a hotel should be reprimanded.  When the staff moves carts over the surface it is VERY loud. So the breakfast, the poor staff need a redesign for the space.  Cords running through stupid shutters on the wall.  Just some fruit, cereal, coffee, tea, waffle makers, milk, juice - nothing fancy but fresh.  Did I mention the staff was very nice? The reception area is also poorly designed.  Staff have to run wires for their PCs through those stupid design shutters.  I mean it looks like it was last retrofitted before computers. Over all the hotel was clean except how can they keep it very clean if there

Summary Heading: Good hotel for a business trip
Summary: I have stayed here many times while visiting clients in the area.  Reasonably priced for Orange county, clean and close to restaurants.  The hotel staff is very pleasant, but the breakfast does leave something to be desired.  Overall, a descent value.

What makes this hotel so great is the front desk. So friendly and helpful with directions wake up calls etc.They are renovating the entire hotel .The fifth floor is completely renovated so ask to stay on that floor.Very nice breakfast with lots of choices. Easy to find right off I-5 close to NewPort beach,Laguna Beach and San Juan Capistrano.!5 minutes from the John Wayne Airport.

Summary Heading: Good if you like Holiday Inn
Summary: This property is adequate - clean, close to freeway, poor sound insulation, low water flow, thin towels, behind a gas station, breakfast is included and they seem to have a good business, parking is convenient and secure. Stay away from rooms by the elevator - very noisy.

i cam with my parents and the place was nice and breakfast area was good. the only thing is that they are not good in communications. my dad forgot his belt there so we called in and they said they will call us back and they did not for 2 weeks. i called in again and they said they did not find it. really sad.

Summary Heading: Convenient location, good value and service
Summary: We had a very clean room with pretty comfortable beds on the 4th floor. We had asked for a high floor and were told the 5th floor (top) was under renovation.  We had also asked for quiet room and were told it was a quiet location and since the entire hotel is near the 5 it worked out well. We could hear some traffic, but not enough to matter.  There was free wireless, Internet throughout the hotel that worked well.  There were also 2 computers with very slow Internet in the same room as the gym, which had newer looking equipment and we never saw anyone using any of it in the 4 days we were there.  The hotel is in a strange location, behind two gas stations, but very, very convenient for everything we wanted to see and do.  The breakfast was pretty standard and with a lot of

I stayed at this property for 3 nights in early December '11.  The property did have a note in my room letting me know that they were about to begin a property renovation.  Thank goodness for that.  I know it's a Fairfield Inn but the beds, linens, and fitness area should have been upgraded about 2-3 years ago.  I wonder if they were left over from when the property was a Hampton Inn.  With that said the property is very convenient to the SoCal freeway system if you need to go to San Diego, LA, or the beach.  The continental breakfast program was nice.  I look forward to possibly revisiting the property after the renovation.  I hope they speed up the snail like elevators.

Summary Heading: What are they thinking with those beds?
Summary: My husband normally sleeps like a dead person. I have to shake him awake. He can sleep on almost any surface comfortably, while I am the proverbial "princess and the pea" type.   So when, at 4am, I finally gave up trying to sleep by telling my husband, "I want to set this bed on fire and throw it in the pool," I was rather surprised to hear him respond with, "That bad, eh?" His coherent response was proof that the beds really were that bad, because if he'd been sleeping comfortably, he wouldn't even have heard me.  The rest of the hotel was fine. I requested and received a mini fridge in the room, the breakfast spread looked pretty good, the pool was clean and the staff was helpful. But sleeping is a pretty big part of the hotel experience, and I can't fathom how they have such

Overall, an OK Hotel. Was a little worried of the property since they had a lot of secuirty cameras and the rooms each had a signs saying-'don't leave your key in the door". Really! Do people actually leave their key in the door? The rooms were older and my bathroom faucets were dripping. The breakfast buffet was standard fare. The workout room was a combo workout room and business center- that's a first for me. They only had cardio equipment- but it was newer Life Fitness, so not bad. The pool was outside, nice, and in good shape.

I don't have a gripe about the noise like many others have but I do feel I was somewhat taken advantage of.  I spent $129 for a night there last night and I know I'm the one that chose to stay there but looking back on it I just feel like I didn't get $130 worth of value... Breakfast options were fairly limited too...  Not sure if I'll stay there the next time I'm in town...  If it was $89 per night, I'd be all over it. :)

The room was just okay. Not much room to walk around in. And the bed was too hard. The shower was fine. The tv channel selection was good too. And the towels were too thin. Other than that,the room was good.

Stayed here during our home search in area.  The rooms are clean, the staff was helpful, the pool and Jacuzzi were nice and the exercise room had the basic exercises machine necessary to get a decent workout.  While it is tucked in behind a couple of gas stations, there's easy access to the highway, a Starbucks and fast-food within walking distance and sit-down restaurants within a few minutes drive.  The 2 gas stations were handy as we did a lot of driving and the location was perfect for travel between Irvine, Mission Viejo, Laguna Hills and Lake Forest. The complementary breakfast was very popular and was always kept well stocked.  On one night, a couple of rooms down the hall were getting rowdy but a short call to the front desk and it was taken care of immediately.  All in

Summary Heading: Nice, clean hotel with easy access to interstate 5.
Summary: Very pleased with this hotel that we had just selected off the internet during a sort visit in Orange County.  Our only negative was the Styrofoam plates/cups that were used for the complimentary breakfast -- Not very environmentally friendly!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Mission Viejo
Summary: We rented two rooms at the Fairfield Inn in Mission Viejo for my nephew's wedding in Dana Point. We got a very good rate of about $70-75 for each room and found the location to be very convenient. The hotel is right off of the freeway, easy to get in and out of. There was plenty of parking. It's a little bit of an older hotel, but well maintained. The hotel is probably 2-3 star, but very clean and the staff were very friendly and accomodating. For the price, I couldn't have been happier. My Mom and brother had the continental breakfast they put out, and I think they were fairly pleased. We didn't use the pool, but it looked nice.

After changing from another hotel in the area after years of annual returns, we tried the Fairfield Inn at Mission Viejo. When we called we were told we would have a fridge and microwave in the room waiting. Oops, sorry don't have.  "Maybe in the morning when we can get a key from maintenance." The room we reserved for 7 days is next to the fwy and noisy. On top of that they are doing evening street work below, which they convieniently failed to tell us when we called..  Room is very small, as are the beds.

Summary Heading: Great property, excellent staff, nice breakfast
Summary: Everything sparkles at this hotel. Staff was awesome, especially Frank at the front desk. Room with two double beds was just a bit cramped but clean and comfortable nevertheless. Mattress was firm, just the way I like it, but my son thought it was too firm.

It's like the only Marriott property below $100 in SoCal.  Good location, but a little loud if you are on the side by Hwy 5.  Don't stay by the vending/ice machines either!  Good breakfast and shuttle available.  Safe neighborhood - don't let the gas station throw you.

Stayed one night for a family party in Dana Point--very convenient location.   It's about 5 minutes from the mission at San Juan Capistrano and 10 minutes from downtown Dana Point.  Comfortable, quiet and a great rate--small bathroom and counter space, but adequate for one person getting ready in the morning.  We asked specifically for a room away from the freeway and they complied cheerfully.  However, the hotel is surrounded by freeway, off-ramp, and busy road, so all the rooms have street-side windows-but it was still very quiet in our 2nd floor room.  We will definitely book there again.

Summary Heading: Very over priced,poor excuse for a breakfast
Summary: Hotel is behind a gas station, next to a noisy freeway. One of the smallest hotel rooms I have stayed in. Poor breakfast selection.Over priced for what you get. Surprised it has the Marriot name.  Skip this place.

Found this after reviewing other tripadvisor ratings and found them right on.  Location off Freeway makes is great halfway point between San Diego and Disney.  Value for money was very good especially with free internet and continental breakfast.  Only downside is pool appeared to be not as clean as we would like as it was under trees, although other landscaping for the property was very good.  Clean and dependable.  Happy travels.

Stayed 16 days on business. Front desk are the best so knowlegable with directions and friendly .They make you feel like family.It is a very clean hotel and there is aomeone always cleaning.They have a business offiice with 2 computers and they are in the exercize room so you it reminds you to exercize.They have a very nice free breakfast every morning. The restaurants are close by and many shopping centers in the area,!0 minutes from Laguna Beach and Newport etc.My favorite 10 minutes from the San juan Mission of Capistrano.

This is one of the nicest Fairfield Inns I have seen. Grounds are well manicured, common areas and rooms alike are clean, updated and well cared for. And their rates are a STEAL for this area of Orange County. I will definitely stay here again.

Stayed here for 6 nights during a holiday in the US.  Hotel room was OK, nice bathroom.  Kept clean during stay.  Location not very good, no good if you have not got your own transport.  Only problem I had with this hotel was the size of the area for the breakfast buffet.  Judging by the number of cars in the hotel car park the hotel was only half full when I stayed, yet on one day I struggled to get a seat for breakfast.  There was was a small pool (not heated) and spa out the back of the hotel.  No restaurant in hotel.  There's a gas station and small mini market immediately outside hotel entrance.  There was a business room that also doubled as  the fitness room (2 treadmills).
Nice Hotel Friendly staff. Clean rooms. The ony downside is as usual the wireless server. Other that that very nice place.

Summary Heading: Good Value for Business, Probably not for Vacation
Summary: I stayed at the Fairfield Mission Viejo for business in January, 2008.  As one of the previous reviewers mentioned, it is wedged behind two gas stations, so it is a little difficult to find as you are exiting I-5.    Positives:  Grounds are very clean, one of the better kept Fairfields I have seen.  Front desk staff are friendly, and check-in was easy.  The rate was less than 1/2 what I would have paid for a Courtyard 10 miles up the road, which is a definite plus.  Free wireless that is pretty fast.  Free breakfast as well--standard Fairfield fare.  Having the gas stations right next door is nice if you want to pick up a snack or beverage.  If you are driving for business as I am, there is a real advantage to being literally right next to the I-5--it can save you 10-15 minutes

Nice place, room just fine, quiet, nice pool, freeway convenient.  Breakfast was good, easy parking.  I like that you can walk to a big gas station minimart, 1 minute away, open 24 hours, that had great quality deli-style sandwiches, fresh fruit, etc.  Also a Carl's Jr. fast food place 2 minutes walk away, open late.  Not a real destination, but if you're in the area, a good choice.  I found it a little expensive for what it was, but I imagine that's the fair price in that area.

This hotel, although not the fanciest we've stayed at, was perfect for my family.  It was immaculate and looked brand new.    The staff was exceptionally nice and helpful, providing us with maps and written directions numerous times.  The breakfast was lovely.  And, the price was right!  We look forward to staying there again on our next visit!

My wife and I loved the hotel.  Rooms were clean, breakfast was great and the staff was super friendly and helpful.  I slept better here than I do in my own bed.  As I mentioned, all of the staff was great but I would like to give special thanks to Keva & Lorenna at the front desk as they were the ones that had to put up with me during the day.  They always had a smile and helped us a lot with information and directions.  Hey GM, give them a raise.  I highly recommend this hotel and will definately stay here again if I ever get back to the area.  Gary Burden Crystal Lake, IL

The Fairfield was very clean, very comfortable, with  very accommodating people at the desk. The location wasn't the greatest----stuck right behind two gas stations and right next to the highway. The highway was very loud when swimming in the pool but you couldn'r hear it in the rooms. A good alternative to the pricey hotels in Laguna and surrounding beach areas.

If we are ever in the area again, we would not return to this hotel. Being the most expensive hotel of the three we stayed at during our trip, we didn't expect a tiny room, stone-hard beds, pillows with hard clumps in them, shower water that is barely above tepid (at 10:30 at night), and our favorite...a toilet that was picky about flushing-either you had to dump an ice bucket of water into it or wiggle the handle till you got carpal syndrome. Nope, we don't need to ever do this hotel again. The staff was friendly and helpful enough, the continental breakfast was average.

I had a wonderful time at the Fairfield Inn.  I was informed that the hotle was just renovated and judging from the previous review what a difference.  The rooms were apparently gutted and there are even more amedities like high speed wireless internet.  I couldn't be more thrilled with my stay, at least for the price.  It is no Ritz, but the staff treat you like you are at a 4 star hotel.

The rooms were very clean, but the decor could use some updating. The continental breakfast was good. The mattresses, however, were very uncomfortable and appeared extremely old. This was not a one room problem. We had family in three other rooms and all of their mattresses had the same problem.
